And then the requisites of others would not be, because of the non-existence of the one who would use them. And then the requisites of others would not be, because of the non-existence of

original: anavaṭṭhitabhāvato. Evaṃ attuddesikabhāvena padadvayassa atthaṃ vatvā idāni kammaphalavasena🔽vattuṃ “sace vā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Atītapaccuppannavasena suññataṃ dassetvā idāni🔽paccuppannānāgatavasena taṃ dassento “idāni panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Evaṃ adhimuccantoti🔽edisaṃ adhimuttiṃ pavattento. Vibhavissatīti vinassissati. Vibhavo hi vināso. Tenāha
analyzed: anavaṭṭhita bhāvataḥ evam attuddesika bhāvena pada dvayassa attham vatvā idāni kamma phala vasena  vattum sace vā pana atiādi vuttam atīta paccuppanna vasena suññatam dassetvā idāni  paccuppanna anāgata vasena tam dassentaḥ idāni pana atiādi vuttam evam adhimuccanto ti  edisam adhimuttim pavattentaḥ vibhavissati iti vinassissati vibhavaḥ hi vināsaḥ tena āha
translated: and by way of non-restraint. Having thus stated the meaning of the two terms by way of self-reference, he now said “Or else” in order to state it by way of kamma and its result.🔽Having shown the voidness by way of past and present, he now said “But if” in order to show it by way of present and future.🔽Thus resolved:🔽having aroused such resolution. Will be destroyed: will perish. For destruction is perishing. Hence he said:🔽🔽

original: “bhijjissatī”ti. Vibhavadassanaṃ vibhavoti uttarapadalopena vuttanti āha “vibhavadassanenā”ti.🔽Vibhavadassanaṃ nāma accantāya vināsassa dassanaṃ. Tanti ariyamaggaṃ. Sāmaññajotanā🔽hesā visesaniṭṭhā hotīti tatiyamaggavasena attho veditabbo.🔽Upari maggaphalanti aggamaggaphalaṃ. Natthi etissā jātiyā antaranti anantarā, anantarā
analyzed: bhijjissati iti vibhava dassanam vibhavaḥ ti uttara pada lopena vuttanti āha vibhava dassanena ati 🔽vibhava dassanam nāma accantāya vināsassa dassanam tanti ariya maggam sāmañña jotanā 🔽he sā visesa niṭṭhā hoti iti tatiya magga vasena attho veditabbo 🔽upari magga phalanti aggamagga phalam natthi etissā jātiyā antaranti anantarā anantarā
translated: As to non-reversal. Having thus stated the meaning of the two terms as referring to the self-identification, he now said “Or else” in order to state it as referring to kamma and its fruit. Having shown the voidness as past and present, he now said “But if he is a beginner” in order to show it as present and future. “If he resolves thus”: if he arouses such resolution. “Will be destroyed”: will be broken up. For destruction is breaking up. Hence he said “will be broken up.” The seeing of destruction is stated by ellipsis of the latter part of the compound as “the seeing of destruction” . Hence he said “by the seeing of destruction.” The seeing of destruction is the seeing of utter destruction. “That”: the noble path. This is a simile for the state of being a recluse. The meaning should be understood as stated by the third path. “The higher path and fruit”: the supreme path and fruit. “There is no interruption to this kind of birth”: there is no interruption to this kind of birth.

original: vipassanā maggassa. Gotrabhū pana anulomavīthipariyāpannattā vipassanāgatikaṃ vā
analyzed: vipassanā maggassa gotra bhū pana anuloma vīthi pariyāpanna ttā vipassanā gatikam vā
translated: and the path of insight. But the threshold state is called “of the path” because it is included in the path of conformity.

original: siyā, nibbānārammaṇattā maggagatikaṃ vāti na tena maggo antariko nāma hoti. Tenāha
analyzed: siyā nibbāna ārammaṇa ttā magga gatikam vā ati na tena maggaḥ antarikaḥ nāma hoti tena āha
translated: Or it is called “of the path” because it has Nibbāna as its object. But the path is not called “intermediate” because of that. Hence it is said:

original: “vipassanā maggassa āsannānantaraṃ nāmā”ti. Phalaṃ pana nibbānārammaṇattā kilesānaṃ
analyzed: vipassanā maggassa āsanna anantaram nāma ati phalam pana nibbāna ārammaṇa ttā kilesānam
translated: “It is called ‘near neighbour of the path of insight.’ ” But the fruition is called “of the path” because it has Nibbāna as its object, because it occurs by way of abandoning defilements, and because it is supramundane.

original: pajahanavasena pavattanato lokuttarabhāvato ca kammamaggagatikameva, kusalavipākabhāvena🔽pana nesaṃ attho pabhedoti vipassanāya phalassa siyā anantaratāti vuttaṃ “phalassa
analyzed: pajahana vasena pavattanato lokuttara bhāvato ca kamma magga gatikam eva kusala vipāka bhāvena  pana nesam atthaḥ pabhedaḥ ti vipassanāya phalassa siyā anantara tā ti vuttam phalassa
translated: But because it is the result of profitable action, it is not of the same meaning and kind as insight.🔽Therefore it is said: “It is called ‘far neighbour of the fruition.’ ”

original: dūrānantaraṃ nāmā”ti. “Āsavānaṃ khayo”ti pana aggamagge vuccamāne vipassanānaṃ āsannatāya
analyzed: dūra anantaram nāma ati āsavānam khayaḥ ti pana aggamagge vuccamāne vipassanānam āsanna tāya
translated: But when the exhaustion of taints is mentioned in the supreme path, there is nothing to be said about the nearness of insight.

original: vattabbameva natthi. Atasitāyeti na tasitabbe tāsaṃ anāpajjitabbe. Tāsoti tāsahetu
analyzed: vattabbam eva natthi a tasitāya iti na tasitabbe tāsam an āpajjitabbe tāsaḥ ti tāsa hetu
translated: “Not to be feared”: not to be feared, not to be terrified, not to be gripped by fear. “Fear” is a cause for fear.🔽“He is afraid of this,” thus he is called “terrified” . “The untaught ordinary person”: the person who has not seen the noble ones and is not skilled in the Dhamma of the noble ones.

original: “tasati etasmā”ti katvā. Soti assutavā puthujjano. Tilakkhaṇāhatanti aniccatādilakkhaṇattayalakkhitaṃ.
analyzed: tasati etasmā iti katvā saḥ ti assutavā puthujjanaḥ ti lakkhaṇa āhatam ti anicca tā ādi lakkhaṇa ttaya lakkhitam
translated: “Marked with the three characteristics”: characterized by the three characteristics beginning with impermanence.

original: Manamhi naṭṭhoti īsakaṃ naṭṭhomhi, tato parampi tattheva ṭhatvā kiñci apūritattā
analyzed: naṭṭho ti īsakam naṭṭho mhi tato param pi tattha iva ṭhatvā kiñci a pūrita ttā
translated: ‘I am half-lost’ means ‘I am half-lost’, and the intention is that he is ‘freed’ because he has not fulfilled anything further even while standing there.

original: eva muttoti adhippāyo. “Na tāso nāma hotī”ti vatvā tassa atāsabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “na🔽hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kalyāṇaputhujjano hi bhayatupaṭṭhānañāṇena “sabhayā saṅkhārā”ti
analyzed: eva muttaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ na tāsaḥ nāma hoti iti vatvā tassa a tāsa bhāvam dassetum na  hi itiādi vuttam kalyāṇa puthujjanaḥ hi bhaya tu paṭṭhāna ñāṇena sabhayā
translated: After saying ‘he is not frightened’, in order to show his state of being without fear, ‘he is not terrified’ is said.

original: vipassanto na uttasati.
analyzed: vipassantaḥ naḥ uttasati
translated: For a good worldling, when he is contemplating the formations as fearful by means of the knowledge of the appearance of fear, he is not frightened.

original: Udānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Upādānaparipavattasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: udāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Exalted Utterance is finished.🔽The explanation of the Sutta on the Round of Kamma-formations

original: 56. Catunnaṃ parivaṭṭanavasenāti paccekakkhandhesu catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ parivaṭṭanavasena.🔽Rūpaṃ abbhaññāsinti sakalabhūtupādārūpaṃ kucchitabhāvato tattha ca tucchavipallāsatāya
analyzed: catunnam parivaṭṭana vasena ati pacceka khandhesu catunnam ariya saccānam parivaṭṭana vasena  rūpam sakala bhūtu pāda arūpam tattha ca tuccha vipallāsa tāya
translated: By the method of the fourfold round: by the method of the four noble truths in the individual aggregates.

original: “dukkhasacca”nti abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena aññāsiṃ paṭivijjhiṃ. Āhāravasena rūpakāyassa
analyzed: dukkha saccanti abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena aññāsim paṭivijjhim āhāra vasena rūpa kāyassa
translated: I penetrated the truth of suffering by the knowledge of discerning: I knew, I penetrated by means of the knowledge that is distinguished as the truth of suffering that all material form, whether of the primary elements or of derivative material form, is contemptible, and that the perversion of emptiness is there.

original: hānivuddhādīnaṃ pākaṭabhāvato visesapaccayato ca tassa “āhārasamudayā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: hāni vuddha ādīnam pākaṭa bhāvataḥ visesa paccayataḥ ca tassa āhāra samudayā ti vuttam
translated: Because of the obviousness of the loss, increase, etc., of the material body by way of nutriment, and because of the special condition, it is said: ‘With the arising of nutriment.’

original: Dukkhasamudayakathā nāma vaṭṭakathāti “sacchandarāgo”ti visesetvā vuttaṃ. Chandarāgaggahaṇena
analyzed: dukkha samudaya kathā nāma vaṭṭa kathā ati sa chanda rāgaḥ ti visesetvā vuttam chanda rāga ggahaṇena
translated: And by mentioning desire and lust,🔽clinging, kamma, and ignorance are also included. The meaning is: “they are practicing.”

original: ca upādānakammāvijjāpi gahitā eva. Paṭipannā hontīti attho. Vattamānakālappayogo
analyzed: ca upādāna kamma avijjā api gahitāḥ eva paṭipannāḥ honti iti atthaḥ vattamāna kāla ppayogo
translated: This is a reference to the present time,

original: hesa yathā “kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hotī”ti. Patiṭṭhahantīti patiṭṭhaṃ labhanti.
analyzed: ha isa yathā kusalam cittam uppannam hoti iti patiṭṭhahanti iti patiṭṭham labhanti
translated: like “wholesome consciousness has arisen.” “They stand firm”: they have attained stability.

original: Kevalinoti idha vimuttiguṇena pāripūrīti āha “sakalino katasabbakiccā”ti. Yena teti
analyzed: kevalino ti idha vimutti guṇena pāripūrī iti āha sakalinaḥ kata sabba kiccā ati yena te iti
translated: “The perfected ones”: here, the meaning is “perfection by way of the perfection of the qualities of liberation.” He says: “the complete ones, those who have done all that had to be done.”

original: yena avasiṭṭhena te asekkhe paññāpentā paññāpeyyuṃ, taṃ nesaṃ vaṭṭaṃ sekkhānaṃ viya
analyzed: yena avasiṭṭhena te asekkhe paññāpentā paññāpeyyum tam na isam vaṭṭam sekkhānam viya
translated: “By which they might describe them”: by which remaining part they might describe the adepts, that round of rebirths does not exist for them,

original: natthi paññāpanāya. Vaṭṭanti kāraṇaṃ vaṭṭanaṭṭhena phalassa pavattanaṭṭhena. Asekkhabhūmivāroti
analyzed: natthi paññāpanāya vaṭṭanti kāraṇam vaṭṭana ṭṭhena phalassa pavattana ṭṭhena asekkha bhūmi vāraḥ ti
translated: like that of the trainees, in order to describe them. “Round of rebirths”: the cause is called the “round” in the sense of revolving, and the result is called the “round” in the sense of revolving on. “The plane of the adept”:

original: asekkhabhūmippavatti.
analyzed: asekkha bhūmi ppavatti
translated: the occurrence of the plane of the adept.

original: Upādānaparipavattasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: upādānaparipavatta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Round of Rebirths is finished.

original: 5. Sattaṭṭhānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: satta ṭṭhāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Seven Situations

original: 57. Sattasu okāsesūti rūpapajānanādīsu sattasu okāsesu. Vusitavāsoti vusitaariyavāso.
analyzed: sattasu okāsesu iti rūpa pajānana ādīsu sattasu okāsesu vusita vāso ti vusita ariya vāso
translated: “In the seven situations”: in the seven situations of the discerning of form, etc. “The one who has lived the life”: the one who has lived the noble life.

original: Etthāti imasmiṃ uddese. Sesaṃ nāma idha vuttāvasesaṃ. Vuttanayenāti heṭṭhā vuttanayena🔽veditabbaṃ. Ussadanandiyanti ussannaguṇavato tosanaṃ sammodāpanaṃ. Guṇakittanena🔽palobhanīyaṃ sekkhakalyāṇaputhujjanānaṃ pasāduppādanena. Idāni vuttameva atthaṃ pākaṭaṃ
analyzed: ettha ati imasmin uddese sesam nāma idha vutta avasesam vutta nayena ati heṭṭhā vutta nayena  veditabbam ussadanandiyanti ussanna guṇavato tosanam sammodāpanam guṇa kittanena  palobhanīyam sekkha kalyāṇa puthujjanānam pasāda uppādanena idāni vuttam eva attham pākaṭam
translated: ‘Here’ means in this heading. ‘The rest’ is what remains after the rest has been mentioned. ‘In the way already stated’ means that it should be understood in the way already stated above. ‘Delighting in the higher’: delighting in one who has outstanding qualities, pleasing him. ‘Attracting’: attracting by praising his qualities, by arousing confidence in the good people in training and in the ordinary folk. Now, the meaning stated is made clear.

original: kātuṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kātum yathā hi itiādi vuttam
translated: “Here” is in this heading. “The rest” is the rest stated here. “In the way already stated” is to be understood. “Delight in the superior” is the delighting in, the gladdening of, one who has superior qualities. “By praising his qualities” is by tempting him. “By arousing confidence in the virtuous and the good” is by arousing confidence in the virtuous and the good. Now, in order to make clear the meaning stated, “Just as” is said.

original: Ettāvatāti pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ vasena sattasu ṭhānesu kosalladīpanena ettakena desanākkamena.🔽Tanti ārammaṇaṃ. Dhātuādimattamevāti dhātāyatanapaṭiccasamuppādamattameva. Imesu🔽dhammesūti imesu jātādīsu. Kammaṃ katvāti sammasanakammaṃ niṭṭhapetvāti attho. Evamettha
analyzed: ettāvatā ati pañcannam khandhānam vasena sattasu ṭhānesu kosalla dīpanena ettakena desanā kkamena  ārammaṇam dhātu ādi mattam eva ati dhātā āyatana paṭiccasamuppāda mattam eva imesu  dhammesu iti imesu jāta ādīsu kammam katvā ati sammasana kammam niṭṭhapetvā ati attho evam ettha
translated: “To this extent” is to this extent, by this much, by the order of teaching in the exposition of skill in seven ways by way of the five aggregates.

original: pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ vasena sattaṭṭhānakosallapavattiyā pabhedena vibhajitvā “tividhūpaparikkhī”ti dasseti dhammarājā.
analyzed: pañcannam khandhānam vasena satta ṭṭhāna kosalla pavattiyā pabhedena vibhajitvā dasseti dhammarājā
translated: “That” is the object. “Mere elements, etc.” is mere elements, mere bases, mere dependent origination. “In these ideas” is in these arising, etc. “Having done the work” is having completed the work of comprehending. Thus, having analyzed by way of the occurrence of skill in seven ways by way of the five aggregates, the King of the Dhamma shows “The investigator of three aspects.”

original: Sattaṭṭhānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: satta ṭṭhāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Sattaṭṭhānasutta is finished.

original: 6. Sammāsambuddhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽58. Adhikaṃ savisesaṃ payasati payuñjati etenāti adhippayāso, visiṭṭhapayogo. Tenāha
analyzed: sammāsambuddha sutta vaṇṇanā  adhikam sa visesam payasati payuñjati etena ati adhippayāsaḥ visiṭṭha payogo tena āha
translated: Commentary on the Sammāsambuddhasutta

original: “adhikapayogo”ti. Imañhi magganti aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ ariyamaggamāha. Idhāti imasmiṃ sutte.
analyzed: adhika payogo ti iman hi magganti aṭṭhaṅgikam ariya maggam āha idha iti imasmim sutte
translated: Adhippayāso = adhikaṃ savisesaṃ payasati payuñjati etenāti adhippayāso, visiṭṭhapayogo. Tenāha “adhikapayogo”ti. Imañhi magganti aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ ariyamaggamāha. Idhāti imasmiṃ sutte.

original: Avattamānaṭṭhenāti buddhuppādato pubbe na vattamānabhāvena. Maggaṃ jānātīti samudāgamato
analyzed: a vattamāna aṭṭhena āti buddhuppādataḥ pubbe na vattamāna bhāvena maggam jānāti iti samudāgamataḥ
translated: Avattamānaṭṭhenāti buddhuppādato pubbe na vattamānabhāvena. Maggaṃ jānātīti samudāgamato

original: paṭṭhāya sapubbabhāgaṃ sasambhāravisayaṃ saphalaṃ saudrayaṃ ariyaṃ maggaṃ jānāti
analyzed: paṭṭhāya sa pubbabhāgam sa sambhāra visayam sa phalam saudrayam ariyam maggam jānāti
translated: paṭṭhāya sapubbabhāgaṃ sasambhāravisayaṃ saphalaṃ saudrayaṃ ariyaṃ maggaṃ jānāti

original: avabujjhatīti maggaññū. Viditanti aññesampi ñātaṃ paṭiladdhaṃ hatthatale āmalakaṃ
analyzed: avabujjhati iti magga ññū viditanti aññesam pi ñātam paṭiladdham hattha tale āmalakam
translated: avabujjhatīti maggaññū. Viditanti aññesampi ñātaṃ paṭiladdhaṃ hatthatale āmalakaṃ

original: viya pākaṭaṃ akāsi, tathā katvā desesi. Amagge parivajjanena magge paṭipattīti tassa
analyzed: viya pākaṭam akāsi tathā katvā desesi amagge parivajjanena magge paṭipatti iti tassa
translated: viya pākaṭaṃ akāsi, tathā katvā desesi. Amagge parivajjanena magge paṭipattīti tassa

original: maggakusalatā viya amaggakusalatāpi icchitabbāti āha “magge ca amagge ca kovido”ti.
analyzed: magga kusala tā viya amagga kusala tā api icchitabbā ti āha magge ca amagge ca kovidaḥ ti
translated: maggakusalatā viya amaggakusalatāpi icchitabbāti āha “magge ca amagge ca kovido”ti.

original: Ahaṃ paṭhamaṃ gatoti ahaṃ paṭhamamaggena samannāgato.
analyzed: aham paṭhamam gataḥ iti aham paṭhama maggena samannāgataḥ
translated: I went first: I was the first to go by the path.

original: Sammāsambuddhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sammāsambuddha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta of the Supremely Enlightened One is finished.

original: 7. Anattalakkhaṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anattalakkhaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Discourse on the Characteristic of Not Being a Self

original: 59. Purāṇupaṭṭhāketi pubbe padhānapadahanakāle upaṭṭhākabhūte. “Avasavattanaṭṭhena
analyzed: purāṇupaṭṭhākā iti pubbe padhāna padahana kāle upaṭṭhāka bhūte avasavattana ṭṭhena
translated: Former supporters: those who were supporters in the time of his striving.

original: assāmikaṭṭhena suññataṭṭhena attapaṭikkhepaṭṭhenā”ti evaṃ pubbe vuttehi. Ettakena🔽ṭhānenāti “rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā”ti ārabhitvā yāva “evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ mā ahosī”ti
analyzed: assāmika ṭṭhena suññata ṭṭhena atta paṭikkhepa ṭṭhena ati evam pubbe vuttehi ettakena  ṭhānena ati rūpam bhikkhave anattā ati ārabhitvā yāva evam me viññāṇam mā ahosi iti
translated: In the sense of non-dominion, in the sense of voidness, in the sense of the denial of a self.🔽With this much🔽Discourse: with this much discourse on the suttas, beginning with “Bhikkhus, material form is not self” and ending with “Let my consciousness be thus” .

original: ettakena suttapadesena. Akathitasseva kathanaṃ uttaraṃ, na kathitassāti vuttaṃ “tāni🔽dassetvā”ti. Samodhānetvāti sampiṇḍitvā. Vitthārakathāti vitthārato aṭṭhakathā. Anattalakkhaṇamevāti
analyzed: ettakena sutta padesena a kathitassa iva kathanam uttaram na kathitassa ati vuttam tāni  dassetvā ti samodhānetvā ati sampiṇḍitvā vitthāra kathā ati vitthārataḥ aṭṭhakathā anatta lakkhaṇam eva ti
translated: The answer is the explanation of what has not been explained.🔽Having shown: having collected together.🔽The detailed explanation: the commentary in detail.🔽The characteristic of not being a self: this is said because of the predominance of that and because of the emphasis on that.

original: tabbahulatāya tappadhānatāya ca vuttaṃ. Aniccatādīnampi hi tattha taṃdīpanatthameva
analyzed: tad bahula tāya tad padhāna tāya ca vuttam anicca tā ādīnam pi hi tattha tat dīpana attham eva
translated: For impermanence, etc., are stated there only for the purpose of illustrating that.

original: vuttattā tadeva jeṭṭhaṃ padhānaṃ tathā veneyyajjhāsayato.
analyzed: vutta ttā tat eva jeṭṭham padhānam tathā
translated: Therefore that is the chief and principal matter, according to the inclination of those who need training.

original: Anattalakkhaṇasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anattalakkhaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self is finished.

original: 8. Mahālisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mahāli sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse to Mahāli

original: 60. Ekantadukkhantiādīni padāni vuttanayāneva, tasmā tattha vuttanayeneva attho veditabbo.
analyzed: ekanta dukkha nti ādīni padāni vutta nayāna eva tasmā tattha vutta nayena iva atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The words “entirely painful” and so on are in the same way as before, so the meaning should be understood in the same way as stated there.

original: Ettha ca yathā sarāgo hetu paccayo saṃkilesāya, evaṃ savipassano maggo hetu paccayo
analyzed: ettha ca yathā sa rāgaḥ hetu paccayaḥ saṃkilesāya evam sa vipassanaḥ maggaḥ hetu paccayaḥ
translated: And just as “with lust” is a cause and condition for defilement, so “with insight” is a cause and condition for purification.

original: ca visuddhiyāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: ca visuddhiyā ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: This is how it should be regarded.

original: Mahālisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽9. Ādittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mahāli sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  āditta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Discourse to Mahāli is finished.🔽The Discourse on Burning

original: 61. Ekādasahīti rāgādīhi upāyāsapariyosānehi ekādasahi santāpanaṭṭhena aggīhi. Dvīsūti aṭṭhamanavamesu. Dukkhalakkhaṇamevāti tabbahulatāya tappadhānatāya ca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekādasahi iti rāga ādīhi upāyāsa pariyosānehi ekādasahi santāpana ṭṭhena aggīhi dvīsu iti aṭṭhama navamesu dukkha lakkhaṇam eva ati tad bahula tāya tad padhāna tāya ca vuttam
translated: “Eleven times”: with the eleven kinds of burning, ending with the burning of despair, which are due to lust, etc. “Twice”: in the eighth and ninth. “The characteristic of pain”: this is said because of the predominance of pain and because of the predominance of the contemplation of pain.

original: Ādittasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āditta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Discourse on Burning is finished.

original: 10. Niruttipathasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on the Path of Language

original: 62. Niruttiyova niruttipathāti patha-saddena padavaḍḍhanamāha yathā “bījāniyeva bījajātānī”ti.
analyzed: niruttiyā uva nirutti pathā iti patha saddena pada vaḍḍhanam āha yathā bījāni iva bīja jātāni iti
translated: “The path of language”: the word “path” is used here in the sense of “a collection of words,” just as in the passage “seeds are the source of crops” .

original: Niruttivasenāti nibbacanavasena. Pathā ca atthānurūpabhāvato. Tīṇipīti niruttiadhivacanapaññattipathapadāni.
analyzed: nirutti vasena ati nibbacana vasena pathā ca attha anurūpa bhāvato nirutti adhivacana paññatti patha padāni
translated: As to the mode of expression: as to the mode of utterance. And as to the path: as to the mode of the path that accords with the meaning. The three: the modes of expression, synonyms, and definitions.

original: Tathā hi “phusatīti phasso”tiādinā nīharitvā vacanaṃ nirutti, “sirīvaḍḍhako dhanavaḍḍhako”tiādinā🔽vacanamattameva adhikāraṃ katvā pavattaṃ adhivacanaṃ, “takko vitakko”tiādinā taṃtaṃpakārena
analyzed: tathā hi phusati iti phassaḥ iti ādinā nīharitvā vacanam sirīvaḍḍhakaḥ dhanavaḍḍhaka iti ādinā  vacana mattam eva adhikāram katvā pavattam adhivacanam takkaḥ vitakka iti ādinā taṃ taṃ pakārena
translated: For it is said: “It touches, thus it is contact” , and so on. This is expression as to the mode of utterance. “He who increases glory, he who increases wealth” , and so on.🔽This is expression as to the mode of synonyms. “Thinking, pondering” , and so on.

original: ñāpanato paññatti. Atha vā taṃtaṃatthappakāsanena nicchitaṃ, niyataṃ vā vacanaṃ nirutti.🔽Adhi-saddo uparibhāge, upari vacanaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Kassa upari? Pakāsetabbassa atthassāti
analyzed: ñāpanataḥ paññatti atha vā taṃ taṃ attha ppakāsanena nicchitam niyatam vā vacanam nirutti  adhi saddaḥ upari bhāge upari vacanam adhivacanam kassa upari pakāsetabbassa atthassa ati
translated: This is expression as to the mode of definition. Or alternatively, expression that is determined, fixed, by the mode of the meaning to be expressed is expression as to the mode of utterance.🔽The prefix adhi- is in the sense of above, and expression that is above is a synonym. Above what? Above the meaning to be expressed.🔽This is the obvious meaning. Expression that is dependent is a synonym. Dependent on what? On the meaning.

original: pākaṭoyamattho. Adhīnaṃ vacanaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Kena adhīnaṃ? Atthena. Atthassa paññāpanatthena
analyzed: pākaṭaḥ ayam atthaḥ adhīnam vacanam adhivacanam kena adhīnam atthena atthassa paññāpana tthena
translated: It is a definition because it is a definition of the meaning.

original: paññattīti evaṃ niruttiādipadānaṃ sabbavacanesu pavatti veditabbā. Aññathā “phusatīti
analyzed: paññatti iti evam nirutti ādi padānam sabba vacanesu pavatti veditabbā aññathā phusati iti
translated: This is how the modes of expression as to the mode of utterance, and so on, should be understood in all instances of expression. Otherwise, “It touches” ,

original: phasso”tiādippakārena niddhāraṇavacanānaṃyeva niruttitā, sirivaḍḍhakadhanavaḍḍhakapakārānameva🔽abhilāpanaṃ adhivacanatā. “Takko vitakko”ti evaṃpakārānameva ekameva atthaṃ tena
analyzed: phassaḥ ti ādi ppakārena nirutti tā  abhilāpanam adhivacana tā takkaḥ evaṃpakārānam eva ekam eva attham tena
translated: The words of definition beginning with “Contact” are only a commentary on the words “name-and-form,” just as the words “sirivaḍḍhaka” and “dhanavaḍḍhaka” are only a description of the word “wealth.”

original: tena pakārena ñāpentānaṃ vacanānaṃ paññattitā ca āpajjeyya. Asaṃkiṇṇāti na saṃkiṇṇā.🔽Tenāha “avijahitā…pe… achaḍḍitā”ti. Na saṃkīyantīti na saṃkirīyanti, na saṃkīyissanti
analyzed: tena pakārena ñāpentānam vacanānam paññatti tā ca āpajjeyya a saṃkiṇṇā ati na saṃkiṇṇā  tena āha a vijahita āpe a chaḍḍitā ati na saṃkīyanti iti na saṃkirīyanti na saṃkīyissanti
translated: The words “reasoning” and “reflection” would be a designation of a single meaning in the sense of a description.🔽“Unmixed” means unmingled.🔽Hence it is said, “not abandoned, not discarded.”🔽“Not passing on” means not passing away, not passing away in the future, not passing away in the future.

original: na saṃkirīyissantīti attho. Appaṭikuṭṭhāti na paṭikkhittā. Yasmā bhaṅgaṃ atikkantaṃ
analyzed: na saṃkirīyissanti iti attho appaṭikuṭṭhā ati na paṭikkhittā yasmā bhaṅgam atikkantam
translated: The meaning is: not passing on. “Not rejected” means not denied.🔽Since what has passed away from the state of dissolution has already passed away from the state of arising, etc.,

original: uppādādi atikkantameva hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “bhaṅgamevā”ti. Yasmā desantaraṃ saṅkantopi
analyzed: uppāda ādi atikkantam eva hoti tasmā vuttam bhaṅgam eva ati yasmā desantaram
translated: it is said, “only from the state of dissolution.” Since what has passed on to another place is said to have passed away,

original: atikkantanti vuccati, tasmā tadābhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “desantaraṃ asaṅkamitvā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: atikkantanti vuccati tasmā tad ābhāvam dassetum desa antaram a saṅkamitvā iti vuttam
translated: it is said, “without passing on to another place” in order to show its non-existence.

original: Yattha yattha hi saṅkhārā uppajjanti, tattha tattheva bhijjanti nirujjhanti vipariṇamanti
analyzed: yattha yattha hi saṅkhārāḥ uppajjanti tattha tattha iva bhijjanti nirujjhanti vipariṇamanti
translated: For wherever formations arise, there they are broken up, cease, and change.

original: vināsaṃ āpajjanti. Tenāha “vipariṇatanti…pe… naṭṭha”nti. Apākaṭībhūtaṃ ajātattā eva.
analyzed: vināsam āpajjanti tena āha naṭṭhanti apākaṭībhūtam a jāta ttāḥ eva
translated: they come to destruction. Hence he said, “They are changed, etc., and are lost.” It is not manifest because it has not yet arisen.

original: Vasabhaṇagottatāya vassabhaññā. Mūladiṭṭhigatikāti mūlabhūtā diṭṭhigatikā, imasmiṃ🔽kappe sabbapaṭhamaṃ tādisadiṭṭhisamuppādakā. Punappunaṃ āvajjentassāti ahetuvādapaṭisaṃyuttaganthaṃ
analyzed: vasabhaṇagottatāya vassabhaññā mūla diṭṭhi gatikā ati mūla bhūtā diṭṭhi gatikā imasmin  kappe sabba paṭhamam tādisa diṭṭhi samuppādakā punappunam āvajjentassa ati ahetuvāda paṭisaṃyutta gantham
translated: It is called “bull-natured” because it has the nature of a bull. “Roots-of-wrongness-view-traversed”: the roots of wrongness views, which were first of this kind in this world-cycle.

original: uggahetvā pariyāpuṇitvā tadatthaṃ vīmaṃsantassa “natthi hetu, natthi paccayo sattānaṃ
analyzed: uggahetvā pariyāpuṇitvā tad attham vīmaṃsantassa natthi hetu natthi paccayaḥ sattānam
translated: “As he adverts again and again”: as he learns the text connected with the doctrine of no cause, memorizes it, and examines its meaning, wrong mindfulness persists in him with respect to the object as a conviction that occurs in the way beginning, “There is no cause, there is no condition for the defilement of beings,”

original: saṃkilesāyā”tiādinayappavattāya laddhiyā ārammaṇe micchāsati santiṭṭhati, “natthi🔽hetū”tiādivasena anussavūpaladdhe atthe tadākāraparivitakkanehi saviggahe viya sarūpato
analyzed: saṃkilesāya ati ādi naya ppavattāya laddhiyāḥ ārammaṇe micchā satī santiṭṭhati natthi  hetu uti ādi vasena anussava upaladdhe atthe tad ākāra parivitakkanehi sa viggahe viya sarūpataḥ
translated: and his mind appears to him as if it were a bare apprehension of the meaning arrived at by hearsay in the way beginning, “There is no cause.”

original: cittassa paccupaṭṭhite cirakālaparicayena “evameta”nti nijjhānakkhamabhāvūpagamanena
analyzed: cittassa paccupaṭṭhite cira kāla paricayena evam etat ti nijjhāna kkhama bhāva upagamanena
translated: As he reflects on the meaning in this way, his mind, through long acquaintance, comes to accept the fact that “It is thus,” and it does not go beyond that.

original: nijjhānakkhantiyā tathāgahite punappunaṃ tatheva āsevantassa bahulīkarontassa micchāvitakkena
analyzed: nijjhāna khantiyā tathāgahite punappunam tathā iva āsevantassa bahulīkarontassa micchā vitakkena
translated: When he has thus taken it up by acquiescence in his own choice, and he cultivates it again and again and makes much of it, then wrong thinking

original: samādiyamānā micchāvāyāmūpatthambhitā ataṃsabhāvaṃ “taṃsabhāva”nti gaṇhantī micchāsatīti
analyzed: samādiyamānā a taṃsa bhāvam taṃsa bhāvanti gaṇhantī micchā asatī iti
translated: is undertaken by means of wrong concentration, and it is consolidated by means of wrong effort. It is called “the state of being that” because it is the state of being of that . It is called “wrong view” because it is the view of that .🔽The craving that is associated with that view persists.

original: laddhanāmā taṃladdhisahagatā taṇhā santiṭṭhati. Yathāsakaṃ vitakkādipaccayalābhena🔽tasmiṃ ārammaṇe adhiṭṭhitatāya anekaggataṃ pahāya cittaṃ ekaggataṃ appitaṃ viya hoti
analyzed: laddha nāmā taṃ laddhi sahagatā taṇhā santiṭṭhati yathāsakam vitakka ādi paccaya lābhena  tasmin ārammaṇe adhiṭṭhita tāya anekagga tam pahāya cittam ekagga tam appitam viya hoti
translated: Because of the difference in the conditions, namely, the thinking, etc.,🔽the mind, having abandoned multiplicity, becomes unified, as if collected together, on that object by means of wrong concentration.

original: micchāsamādhinā. Sopi hi paccayavisesehi laddhabhāvanābalo īdise ṭhāne samādhānapatirūpakiccakaro🔽hotiyeva vālavijjhanādīsu viyāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathā hi anekakkhattuṃ tenākārena pubbabhāgiyesu
analyzed: micchāsamādhinā saḥ api hi paccaya visesehi laddha bhāvanā balaḥ īdise ṭhāne samādhāna patirūpa kicca karo  vāla vijjhana ādīsu viyā ti daṭṭhabbam tathā hi aneka kkhattum tena ākārena pubbabhāgiyesu
translated: For this too, having obtained strength of development by means of the difference in conditions, is bound to perform the function of collecting the mind in such a place,🔽just as the functions of piercing, etc., are performed by the different conditions, the saw, etc.

original: javanavāresu pavattesu sabbapacchime javanavāre satta javanāni javanti. Tattha paṭhame
analyzed: javana vāresu pavattesu sabba pacchime javana vāre satta javanāni javanti tattha paṭhame
translated: Thus, when it occurs in this way many times in the impulsions of the prior stage, in the last seven impulsions of all it occurs as seven impulsions. Herein, in the first

original: satekiccho hoti, tathā dutiyādīsu. Sattame pana javane sampatte atekiccho hoti. Tenāha
analyzed: sa tekicchaḥ hoti tathā dutiya ādīsu sattame pana javane sampatte atekicchaḥ hoti tena āha
translated: He is not cured of the first, but he is cured of the second, and so on. But when the seventh impulsion has occurred, he is cured of that too. Hence it is said:

original: “assādentassā”tiādi. Imesupīti dvīsupi ṭhānesu.
analyzed: assādentassa atiādi imesu pi iti dvīsupi ṭhānesu
translated: “He is not pleased with that either” , etc. In these two instances: in the two instances of the past and the future.

original: Paccuppannaṃ vāti ettha iti-saddo ādiattho. Tena “yadetaṃ anāgataṃ nāma, nayidaṃ
analyzed: paccuppannam vā ti ettha iti saddo ādi attho tena yat etam anāgatam nāma na idam
translated: The present: the word iti here has the meaning of “beginning” . Thus it includes the passage beginning, “What is called the future is not future” .

original: anāgata”ntiādikaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Tepīti te vassabhaññāpi na maññiṃsu lokasamaññāya anatikkamanīyato.
analyzed: anāgata nti ādikam saṅgaṇhāti te pi iti te vassabhaññā api na maññiṃsu loka samaññāya an atikkamanīyato
translated: They did not consider: the bulls did not consider. Because the world’s designation cannot be transgressed.

original: Tenāha “atītaṃ panā”tiādi. Khandhānaṃ upari niruḷhā paṇṇatti.🔽Niruttipathasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Upayavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tena āha atītam khandhānam upari niruḍhā paṇṇatti  niruttipatha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  upaya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Hence it is said, “But the past” , etc. The designation is based on the aggregates.🔽The commentary on the Discourse on the Path of the Rules of the Community is finished.

original: 7. Arahantavaggo
analyzed: arahanta vaggo
translated: The commentary on the Chapter on Upāya is finished.🔽The Chapter on the Worthy One

original: 1. Upādiyamānasuttavaṇṇanā🔽63. Gaṇhamānoti “etaṃ mamā”tiādinā gaṇhamāno. Pāsenāti rāgapāsena. Tañhi māro mārapāsoti
analyzed: upādiyamāna sutta vaṇṇanā  gaṇhamānaḥ iti etam mama ati ādinā gaṇhamānaḥ pāsena ati rāga pāsena tat hi māraḥ māra pāsaḥ iti
translated: The Discourse on Grasping🔽Grasping: grasping by thinking “This is mine,” etc. By the hook: by the hook of lust. For that is what Māra thinks of as his hook and his snare. Hence it is said: “The snare that lies above the head, That goes about in the mind” .

original: maññati. Tenāha “antalikkhacaro pāso, yvāyaṃ carati mānaso”ti. Mutto nāma hoti anupādiyato
analyzed: maññati tena āha antalikkha caraḥ pāsaḥ yvā ayam carati mānasaḥ ti muttaḥ nāma hoti an upādiyato
translated: He is called “freed” because he does not grasp at all,

original: sabbaso khandhassa abhāvato.
analyzed: sabbaso khandhassa abhāvato
translated: because the aggregates do not exist for him.

original: Upādiyamānasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: upādiyamāna sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Upādiyamānasutta is finished.

original: 2-6. Maññamānasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Maññamānasuttādivaṇṇanā

original: 64-68. “Etaṃ mamā”tiādinā. Maññanā abhinandanā ca. Taṇhāchandoti taṇhā eva chando.
analyzed: etam mama ati ādinā maññanā abhinandanā ca taṇhā chandaḥ iti taṇhā eva chandaḥ
translated: . “Etaṃ mamā” ti ādinā. Maññanā abhinandanā ca. Taṇhāchandoti taṇhā eva chando.

original: Sā hi taṇhāyanaṭṭhena taṇhā, chandikataṭṭhena chando. Catutthaṃ aniccalakkhaṇamukhena
analyzed: sā hi taṇhāyana ṭhena taṇhā chandikata ṭṭhena chando catuttham anicca lakkhaṇa mukhena
translated: Sā hi taṇhāyanaṭṭhena taṇhā, chandikataṭṭhena chando. Catutthaṃ aniccalakkhaṇamukhena

original: vuttaṃ, pañcamaṃ dukkhalakkhaṇamukhena, chaṭṭhaṃ anattalakkhaṇamukhena. Sesaṃ tīsupi
analyzed: vuttam pañcamam dukkha lakkhaṇa mukhena chaṭṭham anatta lakkhaṇa mukhena sesam tīsu pi
translated: vuttaṃ, pañcamaṃ dukkhalakkhaṇamukhena, chaṭṭhaṃ anattalakkhaṇamukhena. Sesaṃ tīsupi

original: sadisamevāti vuttaṃ “eseva nayo”ti.
analyzed: sadisam eva ati vuttam esā iva nayo ti
translated: sadisamevāti vuttaṃ “eseva nayo”ti.

original: Maññamānasuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: maññamāna sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Maññamānasuttādivaṇṇanā is finished.

original: 7. Anattaniyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anattaniya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Anattaniyasutta

original: 69. Anattaniyanti na attaniyaṃ. Tenāha “na attano santaka”nti.
analyzed: an attaniyanti na attaniyam tena āha na attano santakam ti
translated: . Anattaniyanti na attaniyaṃ. Tenāha “na attano santaka”nti.

original: Anattaniyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anattaniya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Anattaniyasutta is finished.

original: 8-10. Rajanīyasaṇṭhitasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Rajanīyasaṇṭhitasuttādivaṇṇanā

original: 70-72. Rajanīyenāti rajanīyena rāguppādakena. Tenāha “rāgassa paccayabhāvenā”ti.
analyzed: rajanīyena ati rajanīyena rāga uppādakena tena āha rāgassa paccaya bhāvena ati
translated: . Rajanīyenāti rajanīyena rāguppādakena. Tenāha “rāgassa paccayabhāvenā”ti.

original: Rāhulasaṃyutte rāhulattherassa pucchāvasena āgatā. Idha rādhattherassa surādhattherassa
analyzed: rāhula saṃyutte rāhula therassa pucchā vasena āgatā idha rādha therassa surādha therassa
translated: Rāhula-saṃyutte rāhula-therassa pucchāvasena āgatā. Idha rādhattherassa surādhattherassa

original: ca pucchāvasena, pāḷi pana sabbattha sadisā. Tenāha “vuttanayeneva veditabbānī”ti.
analyzed: ca pucchā vasena pāḷi pana sabbattha sadisā tena āha vutta nayena iva veditabbāni iti
translated: and the question, but the text is the same in all cases. Hence he said “should be understood in the way stated” .

original: Rajanīyasaṇṭhitasuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: rajanīya saṇṭhita sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on what is agreeable and what is disagreeable, etc., is ended.

original: Arahantavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: arahanta vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Chapter on the Arahant is ended.

original: 8. Khajjanīyavaggo
analyzed: khajjanīya vaggaḥ
translated: The Chapter on What is Agreeable

original: 1-3. Assādasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: assāda sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on satisfaction, etc.

original: 73-75. Catusaccameva kathitaṃ assādādīnañceva samudayādīnañca vasena desanāya pavattattā.
analyzed: catu accam eva kathitam assāda ādīnam ca iva samudaya ādīnam ca vasena desanāya
translated: The four truths are stated in the way of teaching by means of satisfaction, etc., and by means of origination, etc.

original: Yasmā assādo samudayasaccaṃ, ādīnavo dukkhasaccaṃ, nissaraṇaṃ maggasaccaṃ nirodhasaccañcāti
analyzed: yasmai assādaḥ samudaya saccam ādīnavaḥ dukkha saccam nissaraṇam magga saccam nirodha saccañca ati
translated: Because satisfaction is the truth of the origin of suffering, danger is the truth of suffering, escape is the truth of cessation, and the way is the truth of the way.

original: vuttovāyamattho; dutiye samudayassādo samudayasaccaṃ, ādīnavo dukkhasaccaṃ, atthaṅgamo
analyzed: dutiye samudaya ssādaḥ samudaya saccam ādīnavaḥ dukkha saccam atthaṅgamo
translated: This is the meaning stated. In the second sutta, the satisfaction of origination is the truth of origination, danger is the truth of suffering, and the disappearance of the latter

original: nirodhasaccaṃ, nissaraṇaṃ maggasaccanti vuttovāyamattho; tatiyaṃ ariyasāvakasseva vasena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nirodha saccam nissaraṇam magga saccanti tatiyam ariyasāvakassa iva vasena vuttam
translated: is the truth of cessation, and the escape from it is the truth of the way. This is the meaning stated. The third sutta is stated by way of the Noble Disciple.

original: Assādasuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: assāda sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on satisfaction, etc., is ended.

original: 4. Arahantasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: arahanta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Sutta on the Arahant

original: 76. Yattakā sattāvāsāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sattanikāye āvasanaṭṭhena sattā eva sattāvāsā.
analyzed: yattakā sattāvāsā ati tasmin tasmin satta nikāye āvasana ṭṭhena sattā eva satta āvāsā
translated: As many as are the abodes of beings: in this or that group of beings, the beings themselves are the abodes of beings in the sense of the place of dwelling.

original: Tena yattakā sattāvāsā, tehi sabbehipi ete aggā ete seṭṭhā, ye ime arahantāti dasseti.
analyzed: tena yattakā sattāvāsā tehi sabbehi pi ete aggāḥ ete seṭṭhāḥ ye ime arahantā ati dasseti
translated: He shows that they are the best and the most excellent of all the abodes of beings, namely, the Arahants.

original: Purimanayenevāti purimasmiṃ sattaṭṭhānakosallasutte vuttanayena.🔽Tadatthaparidīpanāhīti “pañcakkhandhe pariññāya. Taṇhā tesaṃ na vijjati. Asmimāno
analyzed: purima nayena iva ati purimasmin sattaṭṭhānakosallasutte vutta nayena  tad attha paridīpanā hi iti pañca kkhandhe pariññāya taṇhā tesam na vijjati asmimānaḥ
translated: “In the same way as before”: in the way stated in the sutta on the seven bases of knowledge.

original: samucchinno”tiādinā tassa yathāniddiṭṭhassa suttassa atthadīpanāhi ceva “anejaṃ te
analyzed: samucchinna uti ādinā tassa yathā niddiṭṭhassa suttassa attha dīpanāhi ca iva te
translated: “In the explanation of the meaning of that sutta”: in the explanation of the meaning of the sutta quoted above in the way stated, namely, “For the full understanding of the five aggregates subject to clinging, craving is not found in them.

original: anuppattā, cittaṃ tesaṃ anāvila”ntiādinā visesatthaparidīpanāhi ca. Jhānamaggaphalapariyāpannaṃ
analyzed: anuppattā cittam tesam anāvila nti ādinā visesa attha paridīpanāhi ca jhāna magga phala pariyāpannam
translated: The conceit ‘I am’ is cut off in them. They have reached the imperturbable, their minds are clear” .

original: atisayitasukhaṃ etesamatthīti sukhinoti āha “jhāna…pe… sukhitā”ti. Taṇhā tesaṃ na🔽vijjatīti ettha tesaṃ apāyadukkhajanikā taṇhā na vijjatīti vuttaṃ. Vaṭṭamūlikāya
analyzed: etesam atthi iti sukhino ti āha jhāna pe sukhitā ati taṇhā tesam na  vijjati iti ettha tesam apāya dukkha janikā taṇhā na vijjati iti vuttam vaṭṭamūlikāya
translated: “They have bliss”: they have the bliss that is included in jhana, path, and fruit.🔽“Craving is not found in them”: it is said that the craving that produces the suffering of the states of loss is not found in them.

original: taṇhāya abhāvā “nandī tesaṃ na vijjatī”ti ettha vuccatīti. Imassapīti pi-saddena
analyzed: taṇhāya abhāvā nandī tesam na vijjati iti ettha vuccati iti imassa api iti pi saddena
translated: Since they are devoid of craving, which is the root of the round, it is said that “delight is not found in them.”🔽“This too”: the word too is meant to include the following.

original: dukkhassābhāvenapīti dukkhābhāvo viya vaṭṭamūlikataṇhābhāvo sampiṇḍīyatīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: dukkhassa abhāvena api iti dukkha abhāvaḥ viya vaṭṭamūlika taṇhā bhāvo sampiṇḍīyati iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and the absence of suffering is included in the absence of craving, which is the root of the round.🔽So they are said to be “utterly happy” when they reach Nibbāna without residue left.

original: Tena hi te anupādisesanibbānappattiyā accantasukhitā evāti vuccantīti. “Seyyohamasmī”tiādinayappavattiyā
analyzed: tena hi te anupādisesa nibbāna ppattiyā accanta sukhitāḥ evā ti vuccanti iti seyya uham asmi iti ādi naya ppavattiyā
translated: The nine kinds of conceit are stated in the way beginning, “I am superior” .

original: navavidho. Ñāṇenāti aggamaggaññāṇena.🔽Arahattaṃ anuppattā. Alittāti amakkhitā. Brahmabhūtāti brahmabhāvaṃ pattā, brahmato
analyzed: navavidhaḥ ñāṇena ati agga magga ññāṇena  arahattam anuppattā a littā ati a makkhitā brahma bhūtā ati brahma bhāvam pattā brahmataḥ
translated: By knowledge : by the knowledge of the path of arahatship.🔽They have reached arahatship.🔽They are not smeared : they are not defiled.

original: vā ariyamaggañāṇato bhūtā ariyāya jātiyā jātā. Satta saddhammā gocaro pavattiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: vā ariya magga ñāṇataḥ bhūtāḥ ariyāya jātiyā jātā satta saddhammā gocaraḥ pavatti ṭṭhānaṃ
translated: They are become brahma : they have attained the state of brahma, or they have been born into the noble birth by means of the noble path knowledge.

original: etesanti sattasaddhammagocarā.
analyzed: satta saddhamma gocarā
translated: The seven good dhammas are their domain, their resort, their foundation,🔽and their support.🔽They have no fear of anything anywhere,

original: Nirāsaṅkacāro nāma gahito kutocipi tesaṃ āsaṅkāya abhāvato. Sammādiṭṭhiādīhi dasahi
analyzed: nirāsaṅka cāro nāma gahito kutocipi tesam āsaṅkāya abhāvato sammādiṭṭhi ādīhi dasahi
translated: and they are endowed with the ten dhammas beginning with right view and ending with right deliverance and right knowledge.

original: aṅgehi sammāvimutti-sammāñāṇapariyosānehi. “Āguṃ na karotī”tiādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi.
analyzed: aṅgehi sammāvimutti sammāñāṇa pariyosānehi āgum na karoti itiādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi
translated: They do not create a new becoming.

original: Taṇhā tesaṃ na vijjatīti idampi taṇhāpahānassa bahūpakāratādassanaṃ. Tenāha “dāsakārikā
analyzed: taṇhā tesam na vijjati iti idam pi taṇhā apahānassa bahu upakāra tā dassanam tena āha dāsakārikā
translated: They have no craving : this is also shown in order to demonstrate the great helpfulness of the abandoning of craving. Therefore it is said: “They are not slaves to craving.

original: taṇhāpi tesaṃ natthī”ti.
analyzed: taṇhā api tesam natthi iti
translated: and they have no craving either.

original: Na vikampanti “seyyohamasmī”tiādinā.🔽Uddhaṃ tiriyaṃ apācīnanti ettha “uddhaṃ vuccatī”tiādinā rūpamukhena attabhāvaṃ gahetvā🔽pavatto paṭhamanayo. Kālattayavasena dhammappavattiṃ gahetvā pavatto dutiyanayo.
analyzed: na vikampanti sā iyyā uham asmi iti ādinā  ettha uddham vuccati iti ādinā rūpa mukhena atta bhāvam gahetvā  pavattaḥ paṭhama nayo kāla ttaya vasena dhamma ppavattim gahetvā pavattaḥ dutiya nayo
translated: They do not waver with the thoughts “I am better” and so on.🔽As to “upward, across, and down”: the first method is that of apprehending the individual essence by way of material form, as stated in the passage beginning, “‘Upward’ is said” . The second method is that of apprehending the occurrence of dhammas by way of the three periods of time. The third method is that of apprehending the entire world system by way of the world-spheres.

original: Ṭhānavasena sakalalokadhātuṃ gahetvā pavatto tatiyanayo. Buddhāti cattāri saccāni buddhavanto.
analyzed: ṭhāna vasena sakala lokadhātum gahetvā pavattaḥ tatiya nayaḥ buddhā ti cattāri saccāni buddhavanto
translated: “Enlightened” : they have awakened to the four noble truths.

original: Sīhanādasamodhānanti sīhanādānaṃ saṃkalanaṃ. Loke attano uttaritarassābhāvā anuttarā.
analyzed: sīha nāda samodhānam ti sīha nādānam saṃkalanam loke anuttarā
translated: “The lion’s roar”: the proclamation of the lion’s roar. It is “unsurpassed” because there is no other in the world higher than it.🔽“Unequalled” : let alone a higher one, there is not even an equal one.

original: Uttaro tāva tiṭṭhatu puriso, sadisopi tāva natthīti asadisā. Sakalampi bhavaṃ uttaritvā
analyzed: uttaraḥ tāva tiṭṭhatu puriso sadisaḥ api tāva natthi iti asadisā sakalam pi bhavam uttaritvā
translated: Having gone beyond the entire world,

original: bhavapiṭṭhe ṭhatvā vimuttisukhena sukhitattādivasena ekavīsatiyākārehi sīhanādaṃ nadanti.
analyzed: bhava piṭṭhe ṭhatvā vimutti sukhena sukhita tā ādi vasena ekavīsatiyā ākārehi sīha nādam nadanti
translated: they roar their lion’s roar in twenty-one modes, such as “We are happy, having attained the bliss of liberation, standing on the peak of existence.”

original: Arahantasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Dutiyaarahantasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: arahanta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽dutiya arahanta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Second Discourse is finished.

original: 77. Suddhikamevāti suddhasaṃkhittabandhameva katvā.
analyzed: suddhikam eva ati suddha saṃkhitta bandham eva katvā
translated: ‘In its pure form’: in its pure, condensed form.

original: Dutiyaarahantasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya arahanta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second arahant sutta is finished.

original: 6. Sīhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sīha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Lion Sutta

original: 78. Sīhoti parissayasahanato paṭipakkhahananato ca “sīho’ti laddhanāmo migādhipati.
analyzed: sīhaḥ ti parissaya sahanato paṭipakkha hananato ca sīhaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ miga adhipati
translated: ‘Lion’: the lord of beasts, who has received the name ‘lion’ because he endures afflictions and because he overcomes his opponents.

original: Cattāroti ca samānepi sīhajātikabhāve vaṇṇavisesādisiddhena visesena cattāro sīhā.
analyzed: cattāro ti ca samāne pi sīha jātika bhāve vaṇṇa visesa ādi siddhena visesena cattāro sīhāḥ
translated: ‘Four’: although they are all of the lion species, there are four lions because of the difference in their colour, etc., which is established by the difference in their species.

original: Te idāni nāmato vaṇṇato āhārato dassetvā idhādhippetasīhaṃ nānappakārato vibhāvetuṃ🔽“tiṇasīho”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tiṇabhakkho sīho tiṇasīho purimapade uttarapadalopena yathā
analyzed: te idāni nāmataḥ vaṇṇataḥ āhārataḥ dassetvā idha adhippeta sīham nānā pakārataḥ vibhāvetum  tiṇa sīhaḥ iti ādi āraddham tiṇa bhakkhaḥ sīhaḥ tiṇa sīhaḥ purima pade uttara pada lopena yathā
translated: Now, in order to show the lion intended here by way of various aspects after showing them by name, colour, and food,🔽he begins with ‘The grass-lion’. The lion who eats grass is the grass-lion. By the omission of the second member of the compound,

original: “sākapatthivo”ti. Kāḷavaṇṇatāya kāḷasīho. Tathā paṇḍusīho. Tenāha “kāḷasīho kāḷagāvisadiso,
analyzed: sākapatthivaḥ iti kāḷa vaṇṇa tāya kāḷasīhaḥ tathā paṇḍusīhaḥ tena āha kāḷasīhaḥ kāḷagā visadisaḥ
translated: it is like ‘the earth-cloth’ . The black lion is the black-lion because of his black colour. Likewise the white lion is the white-lion. Therefore it is said: ‘The black-lion is like a black cow,

original: paṇḍusīho paṇḍupalāsavaṇṇagāvisadiso”ti. Rattakambalassa viya kesaro kesarakalāpo
analyzed: paṇḍu sīhaḥ paṇḍu palāsa vaṇṇagā visadisaḥ ti ratta kambalassa viya kesaraḥ kesara kalāpaḥ
translated: the white-lion is like a cow the colour of a white leaf.’ He has a mane like a red blanket,

original: etassa atthīti kesarī. Lākhārasaparikammakatehi viya pādapariyantehīti yojanā.
analyzed: etassa atthi iti kesarī lākhā rasa parikammakatehi viya pāda pariyantehi iti yojanā
translated: a mass of hair like a red blanket, is what is meant. He has the extremities of his feet like they are treated with lac dye, is the construction.

original: Kammānubhāvasiddhaādhipaccamahesakkhatāhi sabbamigagaṇassa rājā suvaṇṇaguhato vātiādi “sīhassa vihāro kiriyā evaṃ hotī”ti katvā vuttaṃ.🔽Samaṃ patiṭṭhāpetvāti sabbabhāgehi samameva bhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhāpetvā. Ākaḍḍhitvāti🔽purato ākaḍḍhitvā. Abhiharitvāti abhimukhaṃ haritvā. Saṅghātanti vināsaṃ. Vīsatiyaṭṭhikaṃ ṭhānaṃ usabhaṃ.🔽Samasīhoti samajātiko samabhāgo ca sīho. Samānosmīti desanāmattaṃ, samappabhāvatāyapi🔽na bhāyati. Sakkāyadiṭṭhibalavatāyāti “ke aññe amhehi uttaritarā, atha kho mayameva🔽mahābalā”ti evaṃ balātimānanimittāya ahaṅkārahetubhūtāya sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā balabhāvena.
analyzed: kamma anubhāva siddha ādhipacca mahesakkha tāhi sabba miga gaṇassa rājā suvaṇṇa guhataḥ sīhassa vihāraḥ kiriyā evam hoti iti katvā vuttam  samam patiṭṭhāpetvā ti sabba bhāgehi samam eva bhūmiyam patiṭṭhāpetvā ākaḍḍhitvā ati  puratas ākaḍḍhitvā abhiharitvā iti abhimukham haritvā saṅghātam iti vināsam vīsatiyaṭṭhikam ṭhānam usabham  sama sīhaḥ ti sama jātiko sama bhāgaḥ ca sīhaḥ samānaḥ asmi iti desanā mattam  na bhāyati sakkāya diṭṭhi balavatāya ati ke aññe amhehi uttaritarāḥ atha kho mayam eva  evam bala atimāna nimittāya ahaṅkāra hetu bhūtāya sakkāya diṭṭhiyā bala bhāvena
translated: “The lion’s dwelling place is made by the king of beasts, who is powerful by the power of kamma, and who has great authority and majesty, by the mere fact that he is a king of beasts” .🔽“Having placed it evenly” : having placed it on the ground evenly in all parts. “Having dragged it” :🔽having dragged it forward. “Having carried it” : having carried it in front. “To destruction” : to ruin. “The place of twenty bones” : the bull.🔽“The lion is equal” : the lion is of the same kind and of the same nature. “I am equal” : this is merely a teaching device. He is not afraid even of the state of equality.🔽“By the strength of the view of individuality” : “Who else is greater than we? We alone are🔽powerful” . Thus, by the power of the view of individuality, which is the cause of conceit and egoism, and which is the cause of the sign of the over-estimation of one’s own strength.

original: Sakkāyadiṭṭhipahīnattāti sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā pahīnattā nirahaṅkārattā attasinehassa suṭṭhu🔽samugghāṭitattā na bhāyati.
analyzed: sakkāya diṭṭhi pahīna ttā ati sakkāya diṭṭhiyā pahīna ttā nirahaṅkāra ttā atta sinehassa suṭṭhu 🔽na bhāyati
translated: “The lion’s dwelling-place is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s dwelling-place is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s strength is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s strength is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s speed is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s speed is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s beauty is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s beauty is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s courage is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s courage is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s strength is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s strength is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s speed is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s speed is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s beauty is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s beauty is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s courage is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s courage is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s dwelling-place is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s dwelling-place is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the lion himself. “The lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma” : the lion’s roar is made by the power of kamma, not by the power of the

original: Tathā tathāti sīhasadisatādinā tena tena pakārena attānaṃ kathesīti vatvā tamatthaṃ vivaritvā dassetuṃ “sīhoti kho”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tathā tathā iti sīha sadisa tā ādinā tena tena pakārena attānam kathesi iti vatvā tam attham vivaritvā dassetum sīhaḥ ti kho tiādi vuttam
translated: In the same way, in the same manner, he spoke of himself as being like a lion, etc. Having said this, in order to explain and show the meaning, he said, “A lion, indeed, etc.”

original: Katābhinīhārassa lokanāthassa bodhiyā niyatabhāvappattiyā ekantabhāvībuddhabhāvoti🔽katvā “tīsu pāsādesu nivāsakālo, magadharañño paṭiññādānakālo, pāyāsassa paribhuttakālo”tiādinā
analyzed: kata abhinīhārassa lokanāthassa bodhiyā niyata bhāva ppattiyā ekanta bhāvībuddha bhāvā ti  katvā tīsu pāsādesu nivāsa kālaḥ magadha raññaḥ paṭiññā dāna kālo pāyāsassa paribhutta kālo tiādinā
translated: The future state of being a Buddha is certain for one who has made the aspiration and who has attained the certainty of becoming a Buddha by the acquisition of the Bodhi.

original: abhisambodhito purimāvatthāpi sīhasadisaṃ katvā dassitā. Bhāvini, bhūtopacāropi hi🔽lokavohāro. Vijjābhāvasāmaññato bhūtavijjā itaravijjāpi ekajjhaṃ gahetvā paṭiccasamuppādasammasanato🔽taṃ puretaraṃ siddhaṃ vipākaṃ viya katvā āha “tisso vijjā visodhetvā”ti. Anulomapaṭilomato
analyzed: purima avatthā api sīha sadisam katvā dassitā bhāvini bhūta upacāraḥ api hi  lokavohāraḥ vijjā bhāva sāmaññataḥ bhūtavijjā itara vijjā api ekajjham gahetvā paṭiccasamuppāda sammasanato  tam puretaram siddham vipākam viya katvā āha tissaḥ vijjāḥ visodhetvā ati anuloma paṭilomato
translated: Therefore, having shown the state prior to the enlightenment as being like a lion, he said, “The time of dwelling in the three palaces, the time of accepting the king of Magadha’s promise, the time of eating the milk-rice, etc.”🔽For the worldly convention is also a future state, as if it were the result that is accomplished prior to the enlightenment. Having taken the other knowledge together with the knowledge of the future state as being similar in the sense of having the nature of knowledge, he said, “Having purified the three knowledges,”

original: pavattañāṇavasena “yamakañāṇamanthanenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pavatta ñāṇa vasena yamaka ñāṇa manthanena ati vuttam
translated: having made it as if it were the result that is accomplished prior to the enlightenment. By the knowledge that occurs in the forward and reverse order, he said, “By the churning of the knowledge of the pairs.”

original: Tattha viharantassāti ajapālanigrodhamūle viharantassa. Ekādasame divaseti sattasattāhato
analyzed: tattha viharantassa ati ajapāla nigrodha mūle viharantassa ekādasame divase iti satta satta āhato
translated: “Dwelling there”: dwelling at the foot of the Ajapāla Nigrodha tree. “On the eleventh day”: after seven times seven days.

original: paraṃ ekādasame divase. Acalapallaṅketi isipatane dhammacakkapavattanatthaṃ nisinnapallaṅke.
analyzed: param ekādasame divase acala pallaṅkā iti isipatane dhammacakka pavattana attham nisinna pallaṅke
translated: Dwelling there: dwelling at the foot of the Ajapāla Nigrodha tree. On the eleventh day: on the eleventh day after the seven seven-day periods. On the unshakable throne: on the throne in the Isipatana, where he sat down for the purpose of setting the Wheel of the True Idea rolling.

original: Tampi hi kenaci appaṭivattiyadhammacakkapavattanatthaṃ nisajjāti katvā vajirāsanaṃ
analyzed: tam pi hi kenacid appaṭivattiya dhamma cakka pavattana attham nisajja ati katvā vajirāsanam
translated: For that too is called the unshakable throne because he sat down for the purpose of setting the Wheel of the True Idea rolling, which was not to be averted by anyone.

original: viya acalapallaṅkaṃ vuccati. Imasmiñca pana padeti “dveme, bhikkhave, antā”tiādinayappavatte
analyzed: viya acala pallaṅkam vuccati imasmin ca pana pade iti dve me bhikkhave anta ati ādi naya ppavatte
translated: And in this Thread, which is the first of the four Threads beginning with “Bhikkhus, there are these two extremes” ,

original: imasmiṃ saddhammakoṭṭhāse. Dhammaghoso…pe… dasasahassilokadhātuṃ paṭicchādesi “sabbattha🔽ṭhitā suṇantū”ti adhiṭṭhānena. Soḷasahākārehīti “dukkhapariññā, samudayappahānaṃ,
analyzed: imasmin saddhammakoṭṭhāse dhamma ghosa upe dasa sahassi lokadhātum paṭicchādesi sabbattha  ṭhitā suṇantu uti adhiṭṭhānena soḷasahā ākārehi iti dukkha pariññā samudaya ppahānam
translated: the sound of the True Idea pervaded the ten-thousandfold world element, and it was as though it were covering all the directions,🔽with the resolution “Let all who are established everywhere hear.”

original: nirodhasacchikiriyā, maggabhāvanā”ti evaṃ ekekasmiṃ magge cattāri cattāri katvā soḷasahi ākārehi.
analyzed: nirodha sacchikiriyā magga bhāvanā ti evam ekekasmin magge cattāri cattāri katvā soḷasahi ākārehi
translated: With the sixteen aspects: with the sixteen aspects consisting of the four aspects in each of the four paths, that is to say, “ Full-understanding of suffering, Abandoning of origin, Realizing of cessation, and Developing of the path “ .

original: Vuttoyeva, na idha vattabbo, tasmā tattha vuttanayeneva veditabboti adhippāyo. Yasmā🔽ca aparehipi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgatoti ārabhitvā udānaṭṭhakathādīsupi
analyzed: vuttaḥ iva na idha vattabbaḥ tasmā tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ yasmā  ca aparehi pi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgato ti ārabhitvā udāna ṭṭhakathā ādīsu pi
translated: The intention is that it has already been stated and need not be stated here, so it should be understood in the way already stated.🔽And since the meaning of the word “Tathāgata” has also been stated in the Udāna, the Atthakathā, etc.,

original: tathāgatapadassa attho vutto eva, tasmā tattha vuttanayena attho veditabbo. Yadipi
analyzed: tathāgata padassa atthaḥ vuttaḥ eva tasmā tattha vutta nayena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ yadi pi
translated: beginning with the eight reasons, the meaning should be understood in the way stated there.

original: bhagavā na bodhipallaṅke nisinnamattova abhisambuddho jāto, tathāpi tāya nisajjāya
analyzed: bhagavā na bodhi pallaṅke nisinna mattaḥ iva abhisambuddhaḥ jātaḥ tathā api tāya nisajjāya
translated: Although the Blessed One did not become fully enlightened merely by sitting on the seat of enlightenment, nevertheless,

original: nisinnova panujja sabbaparissayaṃ abhisambuddho jāto. Tathā hi taṃ “aparājitapallaṅka”nti
analyzed: nisinnaḥ iva panujja sabba parissayam abhisambuddhaḥ jātaḥ tathā hi tam aparājita pallaṅkanti
translated: by sitting on that seat he became fully enlightened by abandoning all defilements. For that is called “the invincible seat.”

original: vuccati. Tasmā “yāva bodhipallaṅkā vā”ti vatvā tena aparitussanto “yāva arahattamaggañāṇā vā”ti āha.🔽Iti rūpanti ettha iti-saddo nidassanattho. Tena rūpaṃ sarūpato parimāṇato paricchedato🔽dassitanti āha “idaṃ rupa”ntiādi. “Idaṃ rūpa”nti hi iminā bhūtupādāyabhedarūpaṃ sarūpato
analyzed: vuccati tasmai yāva bodhi pallaṅkāḥ vā iti vatvā tena a paritussantaḥ yāva arahatta magga ñāṇāḥ vā iti āha 🔽iti rūpam ti ettha iti saddaḥ nidassana atthaḥ tena rūpam sarūpataḥ parimāṇataḥ paricchedato 🔽dassitanti āha idam idam hi iminā bhūta upādāya bheda rūpam sarūpataḥ
translated: Therefore, after saying “up to the seat of enlightenment,” he said “up to the knowledge of the path of arahantship” without being satisfied with that.

original: dassitaṃ. Ettakaṃ rūpanti iminā taṃ parimāṇato dassitaṃ. Tassa ca parimāṇassa ekantabhāvadassanena
analyzed: dassitam ettakam rūpanti iminā tam parimāṇataḥ dassitam tassa ca parimāṇassa ekanta bhāva dassanena
translated: “The extent of materiality” is shown by this. And by showing the extent of materiality as a single whole,

original: “na ito bhiyyo rūpaṃ atthī”ti vuttaṃ. Sabhāvatoti salakkhaṇato. Sarasatoti sakiccato.🔽Pariyantatoti parimāṇapariyantato. Paricchedatoti yattake ṭhāne tassa pavatti, tassa🔽paricchedanato. Paricchindanatoti pariyosānappattito. Taṃ sabbaṃ dassitaṃ hoti yathāvuttena🔽vibhāgena. Ayaṃ rūpassa samudayo nāmāti ayaṃ āhārādi rūpassa samudayo nāma. Tenāha
analyzed: na itas bhiyyas rūpam atthi iti vuttam sabhāvataḥ ti sa lakkhaṇataḥ sa rasataḥ ti sa kiccataḥ  pariyantato ti parimāṇa pariyantato paricchedato ti yattake ṭhāne tassa pavatti tassa  paricchedanato paricchindanato ti pariyosāna ppattito tat sabbam dassitam hoti yathāvuttena  vibhāgena ayam rūpassa samudayaḥ nāma ati ayam āhāra ādi rūpassa samudayaḥ nāma tena āha
translated: it is as if he said: “There is no materiality beyond this.” “In its individual essence” : in its individual characteristic. “In its concatenation” : in its individual function.

original: “ettāvatā”tiādi. Atthaṅgamoti nirodho. “Āhārasamudayā āhāranirodhā”ti ca asādhāraṇameva🔽gahetvā sese ādi-saddena saṅgaṇhāti.🔽Paṇṇāsalakkhaṇapaṭimaṇḍitanti paṇṇāsaudayabbayalakkhaṇavibhūsitaṃ samudayatthaṅgamagahaṇato.
analyzed: ettāvatā atiādi atthaṅgamaḥ ti nirodhaḥ āhāra samudayāḥ āhāra nirodhā ati ca asādhāraṇam eva 🔽gahetvā sese ādi saddena saṅgaṇhāti 🔽paṇṇāsa lakkhaṇa paṭimaṇḍitanti paṇṇāsa udaya bbaya lakkhaṇa vibhūsitam samudaya tthaṅgama gahaṇato

original: Khīṇāsavattāti anavasesaṃ sāvasesañca āsavānaṃ parikkhīṇattā. Anāgāmīnampi hi bhayaṃ
analyzed: khīṇa āsava ttā ati anavasesam sa avasesam ca āsavānam parikkhīṇa ttā anāgāmīnam pi hi bhayam
translated: “The cankers are destroyed” : because the cankers have been completely and totally exhausted. For the non-returner, too, there is no fear,

original: cittutrāso ca na hotīti. Ñāṇasaṃvego bhayatūpaṭṭhānañāṇaṃ. Itaresaṃ pana devānanti
analyzed: cittu trāsaḥ ca na hoti iti ñāṇa saṃvegaḥ itaresam pana
translated: but he is not free from terror. The knowledge of terror is the knowledge of appearance as terror. But the other gods,

original: akhīṇāsave deve sandhāya vadati. Bhoti dhammālapanamattanti vācasikaṃ tathālapanamattaṃ.🔽Cakkanti satthu āṇācakkaṃ, taṃ pana dhammato āgatanti dhammacakkaṃ. Tattha ariyasāvakānaṃ
analyzed: akhīṇāsave deve sandhāya vadati bhoti dhamma ālapana mattanti vācasikam tathā ālapana mattam  cakkanti satthu āṇā cakkam tam pana dhammataḥ āgatanti dhammacakkam tattha ariya sāvakānam
translated: he says, are those who have not destroyed the cankers. “The mere utterance of the Dhamma” : the mere verbal expression of the Dhamma.🔽“Wheel” : the wheel of the Master’s command. But that is called the wheel of the Dhamma because it is the Dhamma in the sense of what is not otherwise. Herein, for the noble disciples,

original: paṭivedhadhammato āgatanti dhammacakkaṃ. Itaresaṃ desanādhammato āgatanti dhammacakkaṃ.
analyzed: paṭivedha dhammataḥ āgatanti dhamma cakkam itaresam desanā dhammataḥ āgatanti dhamma cakkam
translated: it is called the wheel of the Dhamma because it is the Dhamma in the sense of penetration. For the others, it is called the wheel of the Dhamma because it is the Dhamma in the sense of teaching.

original: Duvidhepi ñāṇaṃ padhānanti ñāṇasīsena vuttaṃ “paṭivedhañāṇampi desanāñāṇampī”ti.
analyzed: duvidhe api ñāṇam padhānanti ñāṇa sīsena vuttam paṭivedha ñāṇam pi desanā ñāṇam pi iti
translated: In both cases, the knowledge is called the “foremost” in the sense of the foremost knowledge.

original: Idāni taṃ ñāṇadvayaṃ sarūpato dassetuṃ “paṭivedhañāṇaṃ nāmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yasmā cassa
analyzed: idāni tam ñāṇa dvayam sarūpataḥ dassetum paṭivedha ñāṇam nāma atiādi vuttam yasmā ca ssa
translated: Now, in order to show the nature of that twofold knowledge, the text says: “The knowledge called penetration” and so on. Since that

original: ñāṇassa suppaṭividdhattā bhagavā tāni saṭṭhi nayasahassāni veneyyānaṃ dassetuṃ samattho
analyzed: ñāṇassa suppaṭividdha ttā bhagavā tāni saṭṭhi naya sahassāni veneyyānam dassetum samatthaḥ
translated: knowledge is well penetrated, the Exalted One is able to show those sixty thousand methods to his disciples.

original: ahosi, tasmā tāni saṭṭhi nayasahassāni tena ñāṇena saddhiṃyeva siddhānīti katvā dassento🔽“saṭṭhiyā ca nayasahassehi paṭivijjhī”ti āha. Tiparivaṭṭanti idaṃ dukkhanti ca, pariññeyyanti
analyzed: tāni saṭṭhi naya sahassāni tena ñāṇena saddhiṃyeva siddhāni iti katvā dassento  saṭṭhiyā ca naya sahassehi paṭivijjhi iti āha ti parivaṭṭanti idam dukkhanti ca pariññeyyanti
translated: and so they are established together with that knowledge.

original: ca, pariññātanti ca evaṃ tiparivaṭṭaṃ, taṃyeva dvādasākāraṃ. Tanti desanāñāṇaṃ pavatteti
analyzed: ca pariññā tanti ca evam ti parivaṭṭam taṃyeva dvādasa ākāram tanti desanā ñāṇam pavatteti
translated: “He penetrated with sixty thousand kinds of knowledge” : this is the twelve aspects of the three revolutions, namely, “This is suffering” and “It should be fully understood” and “It has been fully understood,” and so on.🔽“He” : the Blessed One.

original: esa bhagavā. Appaṭipuggaloti patinidhibhūtapuggalarahito. Ekasadisassāti nibbikārassa.
analyzed: esa bhagavā appaṭipuggalo ti patinidhi bhūta puggala rahitaḥ eka sadisassa ati nibbikārassa
translated: “There is no one equal to him” : he is without an equal.

original: Sīhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sīha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sīhasutta is finished.

original: 7. Khajjanīyasuttavaṇṇanā🔽79. Vipassanāvasenāti etarahi rūpavedanādayo anussaritvā “pubbepāhaṃ evaṃvedano ahosi”nti
analyzed: khajjanīya sutta vaṇṇanā  vipassanā vasena āti etarahi rūpa vedanā ādayaḥ anussaritvā pubbepāham evaṃvedanaḥ ahosin ti
translated: The Khajjanīyasutta🔽“By way of insight” : having recalled the present material form, feeling, etc., he sees that there is no difference between the past material form, feeling, etc., and the present,

original: atītānaṃ rūpavedanādīnaṃ paccuppannehi visesābhāvadassanā vipassanā, tassā vipassanāya
analyzed: atītānam rūpa vedanā ādīnam paccuppannehi visesa abhāva dassanā vipassanā tassāḥ vipassanāya
translated: and that is insight.🔽“He” : the Blessed One.

original: vasena. Yvāyaṃ “na idaṃ abhiññāvasenā”ti paṭikkhepo kato, tassa kāraṇaṃ dassento
analyzed: vasena yvā ayam naḥ idam abhiññā vasena ati paṭikkhepaḥ kataḥ tassa kāraṇam dassento
translated: “There is no one equal to him” : he is without an equal.

original: “abhiññāvasena hī”tiādimāha. Khandhapaṭibaddhā nāma gottavaṇṇahārādayo. Evaṃ anussarantoti
analyzed: abhiññā vasena hi itiādim āha khandha paṭibaddhāḥ nāma gotta vaṇṇa hāra ādayaḥ evam anussarantaḥ ti
translated: “By way of direct-knowledge” is said. “Bound up with the aggregates” are such things as clan, complexion, ornaments, etc. “Recollecting thus”:

original: yathāvuttavipassanāvasena anussaranto. Sabhāvadhammānaṃ eva anussaraṇassa vuttattā
analyzed: yathā vutta vipassanā vasena anussarantaḥ sabhāva dhammānam eva anussaraṇassa vuttattā
translated: recollecting by way of the insight stated above. Because the recollection of the nature of things is stated,

original: “suññatāpabba”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam
translated: it is said “the section on emptiness.”

original: Yasmā te eva rūpādayo neva attā, na attaniyā asārā anissarā, tasmā tato suññā, tesaṃ bhāvo suññatā, tassā lakkhaṇaṃ ruppanādikaṃ dassetuṃ.🔽Kiñcāti hetuatthajotake kāraṇe paccattavacananti āha “kiñcāti kāraṇapucchā, kena🔽kāraṇena rūpaṃ vadethā”ti. Etanti etaṃ bhūtupādāyabhedaṃ dhammajātaṃ. Kena kāraṇena
analyzed: yasmā te eva rūpa ādayaḥ na iva attā na attaniyā asārā anissarā tasmā tatas suññā tesam bhāvaḥ suñña tā tassāḥ lakkhaṇam ruppana ādikam dassetuṃ  kiñca iti hetu attha jotake kāraṇe paccatta vacananti āha kiñca iti kāraṇa pucchā kena  kāraṇena rūpam vadetha ati etat ti etam bhūta upādāya bhedam dhamma jātam kena kāraṇena
translated: Since those same material form, etc., are neither self nor belonging to self, they are void of self and what belongs to self. In order to show the characteristic of that voidness, which is the state of being void, he said, “And why? Because it is formed, etc.”🔽“And why?” is a reason-question. “Why do you say ‘material form’?”

original: rūpaṃ nāmāti kiṃ kāraṇaṃ nissāya rūpanti vuccatīti attho. Kāraṇuddesoti kāraṇassa
analyzed: rūpam nāma ati kim kāraṇam nissāya rūpanti vuccati iti attho kāraṇa uddeso ti kāraṇassa
translated: “That” is that class of dhammas classed as the primary elements and the derivatives of the primary elements. “For what reason” means “for what reason is it called ‘material form’?”

original: uddisanaṃ. Ruppatīti ettha rūpaṃ nāma sītādivirodhipaccayasannipātena visadisuppatti.
analyzed: uddisanam ruppati iti ettha rūpam nāma sītā ādi virodhi paccaya sannipātena visadisa uppatti
translated: “Indication of the reason” is the pointing out of the reason. “It is formed” : here “material form” is the occurrence of a different state by the impact of conditions opposed to cold, etc.

original: Tenāha “sītenapī”tiādi. Pabbatapādeti cakkavāḷapabbatapāde, so pana tattha accuggato🔽pākāro viya ṭhito. Tathā hi tattha sattā olambantā tiṭṭhanti. Hatthapāsāgatāti hatthapāsaṃ🔽āgatā upāgatā. Tatthāti tasmiṃ hatthapāsāgate satte. Chijjitvāti mucchāpattiyā muccitvā,🔽aṅgapaccaṅgaucchedavasena vā paricchijjitvā. Accantakhāre udaketi ātapasantāpābhāvena
analyzed: tena āha pabbata pāde iti cakkavāḷa pabbata pāde so pana tattha accuggato  pākāraḥ viya ṭhitaḥ tathā hi tattha sattāḥ olambantā tiṭṭhanti hattha pāsa āgatā ati hattha pāsam  āgatā upāgatā tattha ati tasmin hattha pāsā gate satte chijjitvā ati mucchā āpattiyā muccitvā  aṅga paccaṅga auccheda vasena vā paricchijjitvā udaka iti ātapa santāpa abhāvena
translated: Hence he said “in cold weather” , etc. On the slopes of the mountains : on the slopes of the world-sphere mountains. But they stand there as high as a rampart. For beings hang there. Within arm’s reach : having come within arm’s reach, having approached. There : in those beings within arm’s reach. Having cut off : having cut off by the cutting off of the state of being overwhelmed by faintness, or having cut off by the cutting off of the limbs and minor parts. In the extremely caustic water : because of the absence of heat and cold

original: atisītabhāvameva sandhāya accantakhāratā vuttā siyā. Na hi taṃ kappasaṇṭhānaudakaṃ🔽sampattikaramahāmeghavuṭṭhaṃ pathavīsandhārakaṃ kappavināsaudakaṃ viya khāraṃ bhavituṃ🔽arahati, tathā sati pathavīpi vilīyeyyāti. Mahiṃsakaraṭṭhaṃ nāma himavantapadese ekaṃ raṭṭhaṃ.🔽Avīcimahānirayeti saussadaṃ avīcinirayaṃ vuttaṃ. Gaṅgāpiṭṭheti gaṅgātīre.
analyzed: ati sīta bhāvam eva sandhāya accanta khāra tā vuttā siyā na hi tam kappa saṇṭhāna audakam 🔽sampatti kara mahā megha vuṭṭham pathavī sandhārakam kappa vināsa odakam viya khāram bhavitum 🔽arahati tathā sati pathavīpi vilīyeyyāti mahiṃsakaraṭṭham nāma himavanta padese ekam raṭṭham 🔽avīci mahāniraya iti saussadam avīcinirayam vuttam gaṅgā piṭṭha iti gaṅgā tīre
translated: Hence he said “in the cold” , etc. “On the mountain slopes” : on the slopes of the world-sphere mountains. And they stand there as high as the surrounding wall. For beings hang there. “Within arm’s reach” : having come within arm’s reach, having approached. “There” : in those beings within arm’s reach. “Having been cut” : having been cut off by the attainment of the state of unconscious life, or having been cut up by the cutting off of limbs and minor parts. “In the extremely caustic water” : the extreme causticity may be said to be stated with reference to the extreme coldness, because of the absence of heat and burning. For that water is not like the water that falls from the great clouds that bring about the aeon’s creation, which is capable of dissolving the earth and which is caustic like the water that dissolves the world at the time of final dissolution. If it were, the earth would melt away. “The Mahiṃsakaraṭṭha” is a country in the Himavanta region. “The great hell Avīci” : the Avīci hell with its surrounding terraces is meant. “On the banks of the Gaṅgā” : on the banks of the Gaṅgā.

original: Sarantā gacchantīti sarīsapapadassa atthaṃ vadati. Etanti ruppanaṃ. Yathā kaṭhinatā
analyzed: sarantā gacchanti iti sarīsapa padassa attham vadati etat ti ruppanam yathā kaṭhina tā
translated: He explains the meaning of the word sarīsapa thus: “It goes (gacchati) while dragging (sarantā) along (gacchantī).” Etan ti ruppanaṃ. Yathā kaṭhinatā

original: pathaviyā paccattalakkhaṇaṃ, evaṃ ruppanaṃ rūpakkhandhassa paccattalakkhaṇaṃ, sabhāvabhūtalakkhaṇanti attho.🔽Purimasadisanti purime rūpakkhandhe vuttena sadisaṃ. Taṃ “kinti kāraṇapucchā”tiādinā🔽vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Sukhaṃ iṭṭhārammaṇaṃ. Sukhādīnaṃ vedanānaṃ. Paccayatoti
analyzed: pathaviyā paccatta lakkhaṇam evam ruppanam rūpa kkhandhassa paccatta lakkhaṇam sabhāva bhūta lakkhaṇam ti attho  purima sadisanti purime rūpakkhandhe vuttena sadisam tam kim ti kāraṇa pucchā ati ādinā  vutta nayena iva veditabbam sukham iṭṭha ārammaṇam sukha ādīnam vedanānam paccayato ti
translated: He explains the meaning of the term “materiality” as “that which goes by flowing on” . “That” : the state of being molested . Just as “hardness” is the individual essence of the earth element, so the state of being molested is the individual essence of the materiality aggregate, the meaning of which is the essence of its own nature .

original: ārammaṇapaccayato. Ayamatthoti “sukhārammaṇaṃ sukhanti vuccatī”ti ayamattho. Uttarapadalopena
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayataḥ ayam attho ti sukha ārammaṇam sukhanti vuccati iti ayam attho uttara pada lopena
translated: “Like the preceding” : like what was said of the materiality aggregate in the preceding section . That should be understood in the way stated in the answer beginning with the words “What is the reason?” . “Pleasant” : desirable object. “Of pleasant, etc., feelings” . “By way of condition” : by way of object condition . “This is the meaning” : this is the meaning: “A pleasant object is called ‘pleasant.’ ” This is the definition, with the omission of the second term .

original: hesa niddeso. Vedayatīti anubhavati. Vedayitalakkhaṇāti anubhavanalakkhaṇā.
analyzed: ha isa niddesaḥ vedayati iti anubhavati vedayita lakkhaṇā ati anubhavana lakkhaṇā
translated: “Feels” : experiences. “The characteristic of being felt” : the characteristic of being experienced.

original: Nīlapuppheti nīlavaṇṇapupphe. Vatthe vāti nīlavatthe. Vā-saddena vaṇṇadhātuādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: nīla puppha iti nīla vaṇṇa pupphe vatthe vā ati nīla vatthe vā saddena vaṇṇa dhātu ādim saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “Blue flowers” : flowers of a blue color. “In a cloth” : in a blue cloth. By the word “and” the color element, etc., are included.

original: Appanaṃ vā jhānaṃ vāpento. Uppajjanasaññāpīti yaṃ kiñci nīlaṃ rūpāyatanaṃ ārabbha
analyzed: appanam vā jhānam vāpentaḥ uppajjana saññāpī iti yam kiñci nīlam rūpa āyatanam ārabbha
translated: Or he is one who is developing absorption or jhāna.

original: uppajjanasaññāpi, yā pakiṇṇakasaññāti vuccati.
analyzed: uppajjana saññā api yā pakiṇṇaka saññā ti vuccati
translated: The perception that arises is called the miscellaneous perception.

original: Rūpattāyāti rūpabhāvāya. Yāgumevāti yāgubhāvinameva vatthuṃ. Yāguttāya yāgubhāvāya.
analyzed: rūpattāya ati rūpa bhāvāya yāgum eva ati yāgu bhāvinam eva vatthum yāguttāya yāgu bhāvāya
translated: For the sake of the appearance: for the sake of the state of visible form. For the sake of the gruel: for the sake of the state of gruel.🔽The person who cooks: the person who cooks the gruel, etc., for the sake of gruel, etc.

original: Pacati nāma puggalo. Evanti yathā yāguādivatthuṃ puriso yāguādiatthāya pacati nipphādeti,🔽ayaṃ evaṃ ruppanādisabhāve dhammasamūhe yathāsakaṃ paccayehi abhisaṅkhariyamāne cetanāpadhāno
analyzed: pacati nāma puggalaḥ evanti yathā yāgu ādi vatthum purisaḥ yāgu ādi atthāya pacati nipphādeti  ayam evam ruppana ādi sabhāve dhamma samūhe yathāsakam paccayehi abhisaṅkhariyamāne cetanā apadhānaḥ
translated: Just as a person cooks, produces,

original: dhammasamūho pavattanatthaṃ visesapaccayo hutvā te abhisaṅkharoti niropeti nibbatteti.
analyzed: dhamma samūhaḥ pavattana attham visesa paccayaḥ hutvā te abhisaṅkharoti niropeti nibbatteti
translated: this same volition-headed group of states, becoming a special condition for their occurrence, cooks, produces, generates them, by means of the other condition states, making them more than mere conditions.

original: Tenāha “paccayehī”tiādi. Rūpamevāti rūpasabhāvameva, na aññaṃ sabhāvaṃ. Abhisaṅkharotīti
analyzed: tena āha paccayehi itiādi rūpam eva ati rūpa sabhāvam eva na aññam sabhāvam abhisaṅkharoti iti
translated: Hence he said “by means of conditions” and so on. Visible form only: the visible form state only, not any other state. He cooks:

original: itarehi paccayadhammehi adhikaṃ suṭṭhu paccayataṃ karoti. “Upagacchati yāpeti āyūhatī”ti
analyzed: itarehi paccaya dhammehi adhikam suṭṭhu paccaya tam karoti upagacchati yāpeti āyūhati iti
translated: he makes them more than mere conditions by means of the other condition states. He approaches, he nourishes, he brings about,

original: tasseva vevacanāni. Abhisaṅkharaṇameva hi āyūhanādīni. Nibbattetīti tesaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: tassa iva vevacanāni abhisaṅkharaṇam eva hi āyūhana ādīni nibbatteti iti tesam dhammānam
