translated: These are merely synonyms for it. For the act of forming is the same as the act of accumulating, and so on.🔽It causes to arise: it is a condition for the arising of those states by way of their appearance as the act of forming, etc.

original: ruppanādibhāvena nibbattiyā paccayo hotīti attho. Cetayitalakkhaṇassa saṅkhārassāti
analyzed: ruppana ādi bhāvena nibbattiyā paccayaḥ hoti iti attho cetayita lakkhaṇassa saṅkhārassa ati
translated: The act of forming, which has the characteristic of willing: this is said because volition is the principal factor among the states belonging to the formations aggregate.

original: idaṃ saṅkhārakkhandhadhammānaṃ cetanāpadhānattā vuttaṃ. Tathā hi bhagavā suttantabhājanīye
analyzed: idam saṅkhāra kkhandha dhammānam cetanā apadhāna ttā vuttam tathā hi bhagavā suttantabhājanīye
translated: For the Exalted One, when analyzing the formations aggregate in the Suttantabhājanīya,

original: saṅkhārakkhandhaṃ vibhajantena cetanāva vibhattā.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandham vibhajantena cetanā u vibhattā
translated: analyzed only volition.

original: Vātiṅgaṇaṃ brahatiphalaṃ. Caturassavallīti tivutālatā. Akhārikanti khārarasarahitaṃ,
analyzed: vātiṅgaṇam brahatiphalam caturassavallī ti tivutā latā akhārikanti khāra rasa rahitam
translated: Vātiṅgaṇa: the fruit of the bread-fruit tree. Caturassavallī: the three-leaved climbing gourd. Akhārika: lacking a sharp taste.

original: taṃ pana paṇṇaphalādi. Yattha loṇaraso adhiko, taṃ loṇikanti āha “loṇayāgū”tiādi.
analyzed: tam pana paṇṇa phala ādi yattha loṇa rasaḥ adhikaḥ tam loṇikam ti āha
translated: But it is also a leaf, a fruit, etc. Loṇikā: where the taste of salt predominates.

original: Ambilādibhedaṃ rasaṃ.🔽Ākārasaṇṭhānagahaṇavasenāti nīlapītādiākāragahaṇavasena ceva vaṭṭacaturassādisaṇṭhānagahaṇavasena
analyzed: ākāra saṇṭhāna gahaṇa vasena ati nīla pīta ādi ākāra gahaṇa vasena ca iva vaṭṭa catur assa ādi saṇṭhāna gahaṇa vasena
translated: Rasa: taste.🔽By way of the apprehension of configuration: by way of the apprehension of the configurations of long, short, etc., and of round, square, etc.

original: ca. Vināpi ākārasaṇṭhānāti ākārasaṇṭhānehi vinā, te ṭhapetvāpi. Paccattabhedagahaṇavasenāti
analyzed: ca vinā api ākāra saṇṭhāna ati ākāra saṇṭhānehi vinā te ṭhapetvā api paccatta bheda gahaṇa vasena ati
translated: Without the apprehension of configuration: without the apprehension of configuration, setting that aside. By way of the apprehension of individual essence: by way of the apprehension of the individual essences of the states.

original: tassa tassa ārammaṇassa pabhedagahaṇavasena. Asammohatoti yāthāvato. Viseso visesatthadīpanato,
analyzed: tassa tassa ārammaṇassa pabheda gahaṇa vasena asammohato ti yāthāvataḥ visesaḥ visesa attha dīpanato
translated: and the words “in the various aspects” refer to the apprehension of the various aspects of the object. “Non-delusion” means according to actuality. “Distinction” is shown by the word “distinction” .

original: aviseso ayaṃ dhammo avisesadīpanato. Tenāha “viseso veditabbo”ti. Jānanañhi avisiṭṭhaṃ,🔽taṃ samāsapadato upasaggā visesenti. Tathā hi sañjānanapadaṃ paccabhiññāṇanimittaṃ
analyzed: avisesaḥ ayam dhammaḥ avisesa dīpanataḥ tena āha visesaḥ veditabbaḥ iti jānanam hi a visiṭṭham  tam samāsa padataḥ upasaggāḥ visesenti tathā hi sañjānana padam paccabhiññāṇa nimittam
translated: “Non-distinction” is shown by the word “non-distinction” . Hence he said: “The distinction should be understood.” For the mere knowing,

original: ākāragahaṇamattaṃ bodheti, vijānanapadaṃ tato visiṭṭhavisayagahaṇaṃ. Pajānanapadaṃ
analyzed: ākāra gahaṇa mattam bodha iti vijānana padam tatas visiṭṭha visaya gahaṇam pajānana padam
translated: which is not distinguished, is distinguished by the prefix in the compound word. Thus the word “perceiving” awakens one to the mere apprehension of the mode of appearance, which is the cause of the higher knowledge. The word “cognizing” awakens one to the apprehension of the object distinguished from that .

original: pana tatopi visiṭṭhataraṃ pakārato avabodhaṃ bodheti. Tenāha “tassāpī”tiādi. Ārammaṇasañjānanamattamevāti
analyzed: pana tatas api visiṭṭhataram pakārataḥ avabodham bodheti tena āha tassa api itiādi ārammaṇa sañjānana mattam eva ati
translated: The word “discerning,” however, awakens one to the understanding of the mode of being distinguished from that . Hence he said: “The same applies to the other two” , etc. “The mere perceiving of the object”

original: nīlādibhedassa ārammaṇassa sallakkhaṇamattameva. Avadhāraṇena lakkhaṇapaṭivedhattaṃ
analyzed: nīla ādi bhedassa ārammaṇassa sat lakkhaṇamattam eva avadhāraṇena lakkhaṇa paṭivedha ttam
translated: means the mere observation of the object distinguished as blue, etc. By the word “merely” he excludes the penetration of the characteristics.

original: nivatteti. Tenāha “anicca”ntiādi. Ñāṇasampayuttacittehi vipassantassa vipassanāya
analyzed: nivatteti tena āha anicca ntiādi ñāṇa sampayutta cittehi vipassantassa vipassanāya
translated: Hence he said: “impermanent,” etc. When one contemplates with the consciousness associated with the knowledge of the characteristics,

original: paguṇabhāve sati ñāṇavippayuttena cittenapi vipassanā hotiyevāti āha “aniccādivasena
analyzed: paguṇa bhāve sati ñāṇa vippayuttena cittena api vipassanā āha anicca ādi vasena
translated: When there is mastery, insight is also with a consciousness that is not associated with knowledge. Therefore it is said: “and he brings it about that the characteristic of impermanence, etc., is penetrated.”

original: lakkhaṇapaṭivedhañca pāpetī”ti. Paṭivedhanti ca upaladdhimeva vadati, na paṭivijjhanaṃ.
analyzed: lakkhaṇa paṭivedham ca pāpeti iti paṭivedhanti ca upaladdhim eva vadati na paṭivijjhanam
translated: And here penetration is said to be mere apprehension, not the act of penetrating.🔽Hence it is said: “But he brings it about that the path becomes manifest by exerting pressure” .

original: Tenāha “ussakkitvā panā”tiādi. Ussakkitvāti ussakkāpetvā maggapātubhāvampi pāpeti
analyzed: tena āha ussakkitvā pana atiādi ussakkitvā ati ussakkāpetvā magga pātubhāvam pi
translated: He brings it about that the path becomes manifest by exerting pressure, by exerting pressure on it, because of the state of non-delusion.

original: asammohasabhāvattā. Yathā lakkhaṇapaṭivedhakāle sañjānanalakkhaṇavasena saññāṇaanurūpavaseneva
analyzed: asammoha sabhāva ttā yathā lakkhaṇa paṭivedha kāle sañjānana lakkhaṇa vasena saññāṇa anurūpa vasena iva
translated: Just as at the time of penetration of the characteristics it occurs in conformity with the apprehension by the characteristic of perceiving,

original: pavattaṃ, evaṃ viññāṇavijānanavasena vāyaṃ anurūpavaseneva pavattatīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: pavattam evam viññāṇa vijānana vasena vā ayam anurūpa vasena iva pavattati iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: so it should be regarded as occurring in conformity with the apprehension by the consciousness-cognition.

original: Idāni tamatthaṃ heraññikādiupamāya vibhāvetuṃ “yathā hī”tiādimāha. Hiraññaṃ vuccati🔽kahāpaṇaṃ, hiraññajānane niyutto heraññiko. Lokavohāre ajātā asañjātā buddhi etassāti
analyzed: idāni tam attham heraññikā ādi upamāya vibhāvetum yathā hi iti ādim āha hiraññam vuccati  kahāpaṇam hiraññajānane niyuttaḥ heraññikaḥ lokavohāre a jātā a sañjātā buddhi etassa ati
translated: Now, in order to illustrate that meaning by means of the simile of the goldsmith, etc., he said: “Just as a goldsmith, etc.”🔽Gold is called kahāpaṇa. One devoted to the work of gold is a goldsmith. One who has not yet acquired, who has not yet developed, the understanding of worldly usage is one of unacquired understanding, a foolish boy. A man who lives in a village and is skilled in worldly usage is a villager.

original: ajātabuddhi, bāladārako. Vohārakusalo gāmavāsī puriso gāmikapuriso. Upabhogaparibhogārahattā
analyzed: bāla dārakaḥ vohāra kusalaḥ gāma vāsī purisaḥ gāmika purisaḥ upabhoga paribhoga arahattā
translated: Because it is fit for use and enjoyment,

original: upabhogaparibhogaṃ. Tambakaṃsamayattā kūṭo. Mahāsārattā cheko. Aḍḍhasārattā karaṭo.🔽Nihīnasārattā saṇho. Ettha ca yathā heraññiko kahāpaṇaṃ cittādibhāvato uddhaṃ kūṭādibhāvaṃ
analyzed: upabhoga paribhogam kūṭaḥ mahā sārattā chekaḥ aḍḍha sārattā karaṭaḥ  ettha ca yathā heraññikaḥ kahāpaṇam citta ādi bhāvataḥ uddham kūṭa ādi bhāvam
translated: and the enjoyment of it is the use. It is a fake because it is made of copper and tin. It is a counterfeit because it is made of a lot of lead. It is a copy because it is made of half the amount of lead.🔽And here, just as the goldsmith, knowing the coin’s nature as a kahāpaṇa coin, etc., and knowing its subsequent nature as a fake, etc.,

original: rūpadassanādivasena uppattiṭṭhānatopi jānanto anekākārato jānāti, evaṃ paññā ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: rūpa dassana ādi vasena uppatti ṭṭhānataḥ pi jānantaḥ aneka ākārataḥ jānāti evam paññā ārammaṇam
translated: by seeing the colour of the gold, etc., knows it in its various aspects by means of its source of origin, so too understanding knows the object in its various aspects.

original: nānappakārato jānāti paṭivijjhati, tāya saddhiṃ pavattamānaviññāṇampi yathāvisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ jānāti.
analyzed: nānā pakārataḥ jānāti paṭivijjhati tāya saddhim pavattamāna viññāṇam pi yathāvisayam ārammaṇam jānāti
translated: And the consciousness that occurs together with it knows the object according to its objective field.

original: Evaṃ svāyaṃ nesaṃ jānane viseso aññesaṃ avisayo, buddhānaṃ eva visayoti idaṃ visesaṃ milindapañhena vibhāvetuṃ “tenāhā”tiādimāha, taṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: evam svāyam na isam jānane visesaḥ aññesam avisayaḥ buddhānam eva idam visesam milinda pañhena vibhāvetum tena āha ati ādim āha tam su viññeyyam eva
translated: So this is the difference in their knowing, which is not within the province of others but is within the province of Buddhas only. This difference is what the Elder is making clear with the words “Therefore he said” in reply to the questioner’s question. That is easily understood.

original: Attasuññānaṃ sabhāvadhammānaṃ dhammamattatāya kathitattā “anattalakkhaṇaṃ kathetvā”ti
analyzed: atta suññānam sabhāva dhammānam dhammam atta tāya kathita ttā anatta lakkhaṇam kathetvā ati
translated: Because the self-empty states that are mere natural dhammas have been spoken of as non-self, it is said that “having spoken about the characteristic of non-self”

original: vuttaṃ. Heṭṭhimamaggā ca yadi adhigatā, arahattassa anadhigatattā “ekadesamattenā”ti
analyzed: vuttam heṭṭhima maggā ca yadi adhigatā arahattassa anadhigata ttā eka desa mattena ati
translated: and because the first path has not been reached, it is said that “only a part has been reached.”

original: vuttaṃ, taṃ aniccalakkhaṇaṃ dassetuṃ idaṃ pabbamāraddhaṃ, itarāni dve lakkhaṇāni
analyzed: vuttam tam anicca lakkhaṇam dassetuṃ idam pabbam āraddham itarāni dve lakkhaṇāni
translated: The intention is that this is undertaken to show the characteristic of impermanence, which was mentioned first,

original: tassa parihārabhāvenāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tassa parihāra bhāvena ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: by way of the other two characteristics.

original: Yasmā panettha “taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave”tiādidesanāya tīsu lakkhaṇesu idameva
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha tam kim maññatha bhikkhave iti ādi desanāya tīsu lakkhaṇesu idam eva
translated: But since in the teaching beginning, “What do you think, bhikkhus? ” ,

original: padhānabhāvena dassitaṃ, idaṃ appadhānabhāvenāti na sakkā vattuṃ, tasmā “tīṇi lakkhaṇāni
analyzed: padhāna bhāvena dassitam idam appadhāna bhāvena ati na sakkā vattum tasmā tīṇi lakkhaṇāni
translated: it is not possible to say that one of the three characteristics is shown here in a prominent way and the other two in a less prominent way, therefore it is said, “to show all three characteristics together.”

original: samodhānetvā dassetumpī”ti vuttaṃ. Apacinātīti apacayagāmidhamme nivatteti ekaṃsato
analyzed: samodhānetvā dassetum pi iti vuttam apacināti iti apacaya gāmi dhamme nivatteti ekaṃsataḥ
translated: “He abandons” : he turns away from states subject to destruction by making them one-sidedly subject to destruction.🔽By fulfilling the way subject to destruction. Hence he says, “He does not accumulate” , etc.

original: apacayagāmipaṭipadāya paripūraṇato. Tenāha “no ācinātī”tiādi. Vaṭṭaṃ vināsetīti vidhamati
analyzed: apacaya gāmi paṭipadāya tena āha no ācināti itiādi vaṭṭam vināseti iti vidhamati
translated: “He destroys the round” : he annihilates it.🔽“He causes it to disappear” : he causes it to go to non-appearance.

original: adassanaṃ gameti. Neva cinātīti na vaḍḍheti. Tadevāti taṃ vaṭṭaṃ eva. Vissajjetīti🔽chaḍḍeti. Vikiratīti viddhaṃseti. Vidhūpetīti vaṭṭattayasaṅkhātaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ vigatadhūmaṃ
analyzed: a dassanam gameti na iva cināti iti na vaḍḍheti tat eva ati tam vaṭṭam eva vissajjeti iti  chaḍḍeti vikirati iti viddhaṃseti vidhūpeti iti vaṭṭa ttaya saṅkhātam aggi kkhandham vigata dhūmam
translated: “He does not accumulate” : he does not increase.🔽“That same round” : that very round.🔽“He releases” : he abandons.🔽“He scatters” : he breaks up.🔽“He extinguishes” : he makes the mass of fire consisting of the three rounds free from smoke and free from heat.

original: vigatasantāpaṃ karotīti atthoti āha “nibbāpetī”ti.
analyzed: vigata santāpam karoti iti attho ti āha nibbāpeti iti
translated: This is the meaning.

original: Evaṃ passantiādi anāgāmiphale ṭhitassa ariyasāvakassa aggamaggaphalādhigamāya desanāti
analyzed: evam passanti ādi anāgāmi phale ṭhitassa ariya sāvakassa aggamagga phala adhigamāya desanā ati
translated: Thus seeing … etc. : this is the teaching for the attainment of the noble disciple’s highest path and fruit of non-return.

original: adhippāyenāha “vaṭṭaṃ vināsetvā ṭhitaṃ mahākhīṇāsavaṃ dassessāmī”ti. Khīṇāsavassa
analyzed: adhippāyena āha vaṭṭam vināsetvā ṭhitam mahā khīṇāsavam dassessāmi iti khīṇāsavassa
translated: With the intention: “I shall show the great canker-free one who has stood by destroying the round of rebirths,” he said: “I shall show the canker-free one who has stood by destroying the round of rebirths.”

original: anāgatabhāvadassanaṃyeva, sabbā cāyaṃ heṭṭhimā desanā suddhavipassanākathā, sahapaṭhamamaggā
analyzed: anāgata bhāva dassanam yā iva sabbā ca ayam heṭṭhimā desanā suddha vipassanā kathā saha paṭhama maggā
translated: The showing of the canker-free one who has stood by destroying the round of rebirths in the future is only a teaching for the attainment of the noble disciple’s highest path and fruit of non-return.🔽And all this teaching below is a talk on pure insight, or a talk on insight together with the first path, or a talk on insight together with the Dhamma of direct knowledge.

original: vā sahavijjūpamadhammā vā vipassanākathāti dassento “ettakena ṭhānenā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vā saha vijju upama dhammā vā vipassanā kathā ti dassentaḥ ettakena ṭhānena ati ādim āha
translated: Showing this, he said: “By this much of a place.”

original: Namassantiyeva mahatā gāravabahumānena. Tenāha “namo te purisājaññā”tiādi. Tattha
analyzed: mahatā gārava bahu mānena tena āha namaḥ te purisa ajañña ati ādi tattha
translated: They pay homage with great respect and esteem. Therefore he said: “Homage to you, O man who is fully enlightened.”

original: nidassanaṃ dassento “āyasmantaṃ nītattheraṃ viyā”ti vatvā tamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “thero”tiādimāha.
analyzed: nidassanam dassentaḥ āyasmantam nīta ttheram viyā ti vatvā tam attham vibhāvetum thera uti ādim āha
translated: Showing the example, he said: “Like the venerable Elder Nīta.” In order to elucidate that meaning, he said: “The Elder.”

original: Tattha khuraggeyevāti kesoropanatthaṃ khuradhārāya agge sīse ṭhapite tacapañcakakammaṭṭhānamukhena
analyzed: tattha khura ggeya iva iti kesoropana attham khura dhārāya agge sīse ṭhapite taca pañcaka kammaṭṭhāna mukhena
translated: Therein, at the very razor’s edge: when the razor’s edge is placed on the head for the purpose of shaving the hair, the meditation subject consisting of the five sense bases

original: bhāvanaṃ anuyuñjanto arahattaṃ patvā. Brahmavimānāti brahmānaṃ nivāsabhūtā vimānā.
analyzed: bhāvanam anuyuñjantaḥ arahattam patvā brahmānam nivāsa bhūtāḥ vimānā
translated: and after undertaking development he reached Arahantship. Brahma mansions: mansions that are the abode of Brahmās.

original: Khajjanīyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khajjanīya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Khajjanīya Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Piṇḍolyasuttavaṇṇanā🔽80. Apakarīyati etenāti apakaraṇaṃ, padaṃ. Apakaraṇaṃ pakaraṇaṃ kāraṇanti atthato
analyzed: piṇḍolya sutta vaṇṇanā  apakarīyati etena ati apakaraṇam padam apakaraṇam pakaraṇam kāraṇam ti atthato
translated: The Pinḍolyasutta🔽is a means of removal, a means of getting rid of, a means of getting out of, a means of escape from, a means of getting free from, a means of putting an end to, a means of abandoning, a means of relinquishing, a means of making to cease, a means of causing to subside.🔽That is why it is called a Pinḍola.

original: ekaṃ. Tenāha “kismiñcideva kāraṇe”ti. Nīharitvāti attano samīpacārabhāvato apanetvā.
analyzed: ekam tena āha kismiñcid eva kāraṇā iti nīharitvā iti samīpa cāra bhāvataḥ apanetvā
translated: He took them out of his own range of action.

original: Tathākaraṇañca evamete ettakampi appaṭirūpaṃ akatvā āyatiṃ sammā paṭipajjissantīti.
analyzed: tathākaraṇam ca evam ete ettakam pi appaṭirūpam a katvā āyatim sammā paṭipajjissanti iti
translated: And he did so thinking, “In this way they will not do anything so improper again, but will conduct themselves properly in the future.”

original: Laddhabalāti laddhañāṇabalā.
analyzed: laddha balā ati laddha ñāṇa balā
translated: Gained strength: gained knowledge-strength.🔽Each one and two by two: each one and two by two is each one and two by two.

original: Ekadvīhikāyāti ekekassa ceva dvinnaṃ dvinnañca īhikā gati upasaṅkamanā ekadvīhikā.🔽Tenāha “ekeko ceva dve dve ca hutvā”ti. Puthujjanānaṃ samuditānaṃ nāma kiriyā tādisīpi🔽siyāti vuttaṃ “keḷimpi kareyyu”nti. Parikappanavasena sammāsambuddhaṃ uddissa pesalā
analyzed: eka dvīhikāya ati ekekassa ca iva dvinnam dvinnam ca īhikā gati upasaṅkamanā eka dvīhikā  tena āha ekekaḥ ca iva dve dve ca hutvā ati puthujjanānam nāma kiriyā  siyā iti vuttam keḷim pi kareyyun ti parikappana vasena sammāsambuddham uddissa pesalā
translated: That is why it is said: “each one and two by two.”🔽The action of the many ordinary men was of such a kind that it is said: “They might even play a trick.”

original: bhikkhūpi evaṃ karontīti.
analyzed: bhikkhū api evam karonti iti
translated: The good bhikkhus, however, who do this do so with the intention of testing the Fully Enlightened One.

original: Yugandharapabbatādīnaṃ antare sīdantaraṃ samuddaṃ nāma. Tattha kira vāto na vāyati,
analyzed: yugandhara pabbata ādīnam antare sīdantaram samuddam nāma tattha kira vātaḥ na vāyati
translated: The space between the mountains Yugandhara, etc., is called the ‘inner sea’. It is said that the wind does not blow there,

original: patitaṃ yaṃ kiñcipi sīdantaranadiyaṃ vilīyantā sīdanteva, tasmā taṃ parivāretvā ṭhitā🔽yugandharādayopi sīdapabbatā nāma. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “sīdantare sannisinnaṃ mahāsamuddaṃ
analyzed: patitam yam kiñcipi vilīyantā sīdantā iva tasmai tam parivāretvā ṭhitā  yugandhara ādayaḥ api sīdapabbatāḥ nāma tam sandhāya vuttam sīdantare sannisinnam mahā samuddam
translated: and whatever falls into the inner sea dissolves and sinks. Therefore the mountains Yugandhara, etc., which stand surrounding it,🔽are called ‘sinking mountains’. It is with reference to this that it is said: ‘the great ocean, as if sinking in the inner sea’ .

original: viyā”ti. Āhārahetūti āmisahetu sappitelādinimittaṃ, tesaṃ paṇāmanā.
analyzed: viyāti āhāra hetu sappi tela ādi nimittam tesam paṇāmanā
translated: For the sake of food: for the sake of material things, for the sake of bile, etc. , the sending away of those .

original: Pacchimanti nihīnaṃ. Tenāha “lāmaka”nti, lāmakanto idhādhippeto –
analyzed: pacchimanti nihīnam tena āha lāmakanti lāmakantaḥ idha adhippetaḥ
translated: The last: the lowest. Therefore it is said: ‘the worst’ . The worst is intended here.

original: “Migānaṃ koṭṭhuko anto, pakkhīnaṃ pana vāyaso;
analyzed: migānam koṭṭhukaḥ antar pakkhīnam pana vāyaso
translated: ‘The jackal is the worst of the animals, the crow of the birds,

original: Eraṇḍo anto rukkhānaṃ, tayo antā samāgatā”ti. –
analyzed: eraṇḍaḥ antaḥ rukkhānam tayaḥ antā samāgatā iti
translated: the castor-oil plant of the trees, the three are the worst that have come together.’

original: Ādīsu viya. Ulatīti abhicarati. Abhisapanti etenāti abhisāpo. Abhisāpavatthu piṇḍolyaṃ.
analyzed: ādīsu viya ulati iti abhicarati abhisapanti etena ati abhisāpaḥ abhisāpa vatthu piṇḍolyam
translated: like the beginning, etc. It overpowers: it dominates. It is a curse because of this: it is a curse. The basis for a curse is slander.

original: Attho phalaṃ vaso etassāti atthavasaṃ, kāraṇaṃ, tampi tesu atthi, tattha niyuttāti atthavasikā.
analyzed: atthaḥ phalam vaso etassa ati atthavasam kāraṇam tam pi tesu atthi tattha niyuttā ati atthavasikā
translated: It has the meaning of fruit, it has the meaning of cause, and that is found in them, therefore they are called ‘those who have the meaning’ .

original: Anto hadayassa abbhantare anupaviṭṭhā sokavatthūhi.
analyzed: antare hadayassa abbhantare anupaviṭṭhā soka vatthūhi
translated: and they are “lying hidden” in the sense of being concealed inside the heart.

original: Abhijjhāyitāti abhijjhāyanasīlo. Abhiṇhappavattiyā ceva bahulabhāvena ca bahularāgo.🔽Pūtibhāvenāti kuthitabhāvena. Byāpādo hi uppajjamāno cittaṃ apagandhaṃ karoti, na
analyzed: abhijjhāyi tā ati abhijjhāyana sīlaḥ abhiṇha ppavattiyā ca iva bahula bhāvena ca bahula rāgaḥ  pūti bhāvena ati kuthita bhāvena byāpādaḥ hi uppajjamānaḥ cittam apagandham karoti na
translated: “One who is full of covetousness”: one who has the habit of being covetous. He is “full of lust” because of the frequency of his lustful thoughts and because of the strength of his lust.🔽“By reason of its rottenness”: by reason of its putridity. For ill will makes the mind stink,🔽not fragrant. “Like a crow”: this is said because the crow’s memory is lost when it finds a place to defecate.🔽It is not said because it is full of excrement. “Uncomposed”: uncomposed in mind.

original: sucimanuññabhāvaṃ. Bhattanikkhittakāko viyāti idaṃ bhattaṭṭhānassa asaraṇena kākassa
analyzed: suci manuñña bhāvam bhatta nikkhitta kākaḥ viyāti idam bhatta ṭṭhānassa a saraṇena kākassa
translated: “The work to be done with a stick”: the work to be done with a stick.🔽because of the words “one who is full of ill will” and “one who is full of lust” and “one who is full of covetousness.”🔽“One who is full of lust” is one who is full of lustful thoughts.🔽“One who is full of covetousness” is one who has the habit of being covetous. He is “full of lust” because of the frequency of his lustful thoughts and because of the strength of his lust.🔽“By reason of its rottenness”: by reason of its putridity. For ill will makes the mind stink,🔽not fragrant. “Like a crow”: this is said because the crow’s memory is lost when it finds a place to defecate.

original: naṭṭhasatitā paññāyatīti katvā vuttaṃ, na bhattanikkhittatāya. Asaṇṭhitoti asaṇṭhitacitto.
analyzed: naṭṭha sati tā paññāyati iti katvā vuttam na bhatta nikkhitta tāya asaṇṭhitaḥ ti asaṇṭhita cittaḥ
translated: It is not said because it is full of excrement. “Uncomposed”: uncomposed in mind.

original: Kaṭṭhatthanti kaṭṭhena kattabbakiccaṃ.
analyzed: kaṭṭhattham ti kaṭṭhena kattabba kiccam
translated: “The work to be done with a stick”: the work to be done with a stick.🔽because of the words “one who is full of ill will” and “one who is full of lust” and “one who is full of covetousness.”

original: Pāpavitakkehi kato, tasmā te anavasesato pahātabbāti dassanatthaṃ. Dvinnaṃ vuttattā🔽eko pubbabhāgo, itaro missakoti vattuṃ yuttanti adhippāyena “ettha cā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pāpa vitakkehi kataḥ tasmā te anavasesataḥ pahātabbā ti dassana attham dvinnam vutta ttā  ekaḥ pubbabhāgaḥ itaraḥ missakaḥ ti vattum yuttam ti adhippāyena ettha ca atiādi vuttam
translated: “One who is full of lust” is one who is full of lustful thoughts.🔽“One who is full of covetousness” is one who has the habit of being covetous. He is “full of lust” because of the frequency of his lustful thoughts and because of the strength of his lust.🔽“By reason of its rottenness”: by reason of its putridity. For ill will makes the mind stink,

original: Evaṃ taṃ bhāventassa nirujjhanti evāti ekekamissakatāvasena gahetabbanti porāṇā.
analyzed: evam tam bhāventassa nirujjhanti eva ati ekeka missaka tā vasena gahetabbanti porāṇā
translated: not fragrant. “Like a crow”: this is said because the crow’s memory is lost when it finds a place to defecate.🔽It is not said because it is

original: Upari tiparivaṭṭadesanāya animittasamādhiyeva dīpito. Tenāha “yāvañcida”nti. Niddosoti
analyzed: upari ti parivaṭṭa desanāya dīpitaḥ tena āha niddosaḥ iti
translated: In the three-round teaching above, only the signless concentration is shown. Therefore he said “at most.” “Free from cankers” means

original: vītarāgādinā niddoso.
analyzed: vīta rāga ādinā niddosaḥ
translated: free from lust, etc.

original: Piṇḍolyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: piṇḍolya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Piṇḍola Sutta is finished.

original: 9. Pālileyyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pālileyya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Pāḷileyya Sutta

original: 81. Pariyādiṇṇarūpacittāti rāgādīhi pariyādiyitvā khepetvā gahitacittā.
analyzed: pariyādiṇṇa rūpa cittā ati rāga ādīhi pariyādiyitvā khepetvā gahita cittā
translated: “Their minds are seized by forms and feelings that have been appropriated” means that their minds are seized and exhausted by lust, etc., that have appropriated forms and feelings.

original: Bhagavato cāro vidito paricayavasena. Satthā paribhogaṃ karoti anuggaṇhanto “evaṃ hissa duggatimokkho bhavissatī”ti. Aññatrāti vinā.🔽Nāgenāti buddhanāgena aṅkusarahitena. Tato eva ujubhūtena cittena. Īsādantassa naṅgalasadisadantassa
analyzed: bhagavato cāraḥ vidito paricaya vasena satthā paribhogam karoti anuggaṇhantaḥ evam hi ssa duggati mokkho bhavissati iti aññatra ati vinā  nāgena ati buddha nāgena aṅkusa rahitena tatas eva uju bhūtena cittena īsā dantassa naṅgala sadisa dantassa
translated: The Blessed One’s conduct is known through familiarity. The Teacher makes use of them by favouring them, thinking: “Thus will he be liberated from evil destinies.” “Apart from” means without.

original: hatthino evaṃ cittaṃ sameti. Tattha kāraṇamāha “yadeko ramatī vane”ti. Etena kāyavivekena
analyzed: hatthino evam cittam sameti tattha kāraṇam āha yat ekaḥ ramati vane iti etena kāya vivekena
translated: “By the Buddha-elephant” means by the Buddha-elephant without goad. Because of that, “with a straight mind.” The mind of the elephant with tusks like ploughshares becomes straight in this way. Herein, he gives the reason: “Who alone delights in the forest.” By this bodily seclusion

original: ratisāmaññaṃ vadati.
analyzed: rati sāmaññam vadati
translated: he declares the bliss of solitude.

original: Attano dhammatāyāti pakatiyā sayameva.
analyzed: attanaḥ dhamma tāya ati pakatiyā sayam eva
translated: “By its own nature” means naturally, by itself.

original: Āsavānaṃ khayoti idha arahattaṃ adhippetaṃ, taṃ pana aggamaggānantaramevāti āha “maggānantaraṃ🔽arahattaphala”nti. Vicayo desanāpaññā adhippetā, sā ca anekadhā pavattā evāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: āsavānam khayo ti idha arahattam adhippetam tam pana agga magga anantaram eva ati āha magga anantaram  arahatta phalanti vicayaḥ desanā paññā adhippetā sā ca anekadhā pavattā eva ati vuttam
translated: Herein, the exhaustion of taints is intended as Arahantship, and that comes immediately next to the path. That is why he said “the fruition of Arahantship next to the path.”

original: “vicayaso”ti, anekakkhattuṃ pavattamānāpi vicayo evāti katvā “vicayenā”ti attho vutto.🔽Sāsanadhammoti sīlakkhandhādiparidīpano pariyattidhammo. Parivitakko udapādi “cattāro🔽satipaṭṭhānā”tiādinā, evaṃ koṭṭhāsato paricchijja desite mayā dhamme katamassa jānanassa
analyzed: vicaya so ti aneka khattum pavattamānā api vicayaḥ evā ti katvā vicayena ati atthaḥ vutto  sāsana dhammaḥ ti sīla kkhandha ādi paridīpanaḥ pariyatti dhammo parivitakko udapādi cattāraḥ  sati paṭṭhāna ati ādinā evam koṭṭhāsataḥ paricchijja desite mayā dhamme katamassa jānanassa
translated: The investigation intended is the understanding consisting in what is taught, and that occurs in many ways. That is why he said “by investigation.” The meaning is that the investigation occurs in many ways.

original: antarā āsavānaṃ khayo hotīti ekaccassa kaṅkhā hotiyevāti adhippāyo. Diṭṭhi eva samanupassanā
analyzed: antarā āsavānam khayaḥ hoti iti ekaccassa kaṅkhā hotiyā eva ati adhippāyaḥ diṭṭhi eva samanupassanā
translated: The Dhamma of the Dispensation is the Dhamma of the scriptures, which reveals the categories beginning with virtue. The reflection that occurred was “the four foundations of mindfulness” and so on. The intention is that some may have doubts as to whether there can be exhaustion of taints in the interval of the knowledge of the Dhamma as taught by me after it has been analysed into its component parts.🔽View itself is contemplation;

original: diṭṭhisamanupassanā. Diṭṭhisaṅkhāroti diṭṭhipaccayo saṅkhāro. Tato eva taṇhāpaccayo
analyzed: diṭṭhi samanupassanā diṭṭhi saṅkhāro ti diṭṭhi paccayo saṅkhāro tatas eva taṇhā paccayo
translated: contemplation of view. The formation that is a condition for view is a formation with view as its condition.

original: hotīti vuttaṃ “tatojo so saṅkhāro”ti. Tato taṇhāto so saṅkhāro jātoti catūsu esa
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam tatojaḥ saḥ saṅkhāro iti tatas taṇhātaḥ saḥ saṅkhāraḥ jātaḥ iti catūsu esa
translated: That is why it is said, “That formation is born of that.” That formation is born of that craving. In the four foundations of mindfulness,

original: diṭṭhisaṅkhāro diṭṭhūpanissayo saṅkhāro jāyati. Avijjāsamphassoti avijjāsampayuttasamphasso.
analyzed: diṭṭhi saṅkhāraḥ diṭṭhu upanissayaḥ saṅkhāro jāyati avijjā samphasso ti avijjā sampayutta samphassaḥ
translated: The formation of view is the formation of the view’s support. Contact with ignorance is contact associated with ignorance.

original: Evamettha bhagavā saḷāyatananāmarūpaviññāṇāni saṅkhārapakkhikāneva katvā dasseti.🔽Ettake ṭhāneti “idha bhikkhave assutavā puthujjano”tiādiṃ katvā yāva “na me bhavissatī”ti
analyzed: evam ettha bhagavā saḷāyatana nāma rūpa viññāṇāni saṅkhāra pakkhikāni eva katvā dasseti  ettake ṭhāne iti idha bhikkhave assutavā puthujjanaḥ iti ādim katvā yāva na me bhavissati iti
translated: So in this way the Blessed One shows that the six sense bases, mentality-materiality, and consciousness are all on the side of formations.🔽In this extent: in the extent beginning with “Here, bhikkhus, the uninstructed worldling” and ending with “It will not be mine.”

original: ettake ṭhāne. Gahitagahitadiṭṭhinti sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā “so attā, so loko”tiādinā pavattaṃ
analyzed: ettake ṭhāne gahita gahita diṭṭhinti sakkāya diṭṭhiyā saḥ attā saḥ lokaḥ iti ādinā pavattam
translated: In the view that is grasped: the eternalist view that occurs thus, “This self, after death, is the same as Brahmā” through the sakkāyadiṭṭhi,

original: sassatadiṭṭhiṃ, no cassaṃ, no ca me siyā”tiādinā pavattaṃ ucchedadiṭṭhinti tathā
analyzed: sassata diṭṭhim no cassam no ca me siyā tiādinā pavattam uccheda diṭṭhim ti tathā
translated: and the annihilationist view that occurs thus, “I shall not be, it will not be mine” through the sakkāyadiṭṭhi.

original: tathā gahitadiṭṭhiṃ. “Iti kho, bhikkhave, sopi saṅkhāro anicco”tiādidesanāya vissajjāpento🔽āgato. Tattha tatthevāssa uppannadiṭṭhivivecanato imissā desanāya puggalajjhāsayena
analyzed: tathā gahita diṭṭhim iti kho bhikkhave saḥ api saṅkhāraḥ aniccaḥ iti ādi desanāya vissajjāpentaḥ  āgataḥ tattha tattha iva assa uppanna diṭṭhi vivecanataḥ imissā desanāya puggala jjhāsayena
translated: In the view that is grasped in this way and that way, he comes to the conclusion with the teaching beginning with “So that formation too is impermanent.”🔽There, in the very place where the view arose, he released it by the investigation of the view. So the occurrence of this teaching should be understood to be in accordance with the temperament of the person.

original: pavattitatā veditabbā, tevīsatiyā ṭhānesu arahattapāpanena desanāvilāso. Tatojo so
analyzed: veditabbā tevīsatiyā ṭhānesu arahatta pāpanena desanā vilāso so
translated: The display of the teaching is by the attainment of arahatship in twenty-three places.

original: saṅkhāroti tato vicikicchāya paccayabhūtataṇhāto jāto vicikicchāya sampayutto saṅkhāro.
analyzed: saṅkhāro ti tatas vicikicchāya paccaya bhūta taṇhātaḥ jātaḥ vicikicchāya sampayutto saṅkhāro
translated: “Formation” is the formation associated with doubt that arises from craving, which is a condition for doubt.🔽If it were said that it arises from craving as a conascent condition, etc., then it would be called “arisen from that,” and that would be inappropriate.

original: Yadi sahajātādipaccayavasena tato taṇhāto jātoti tatojo saṅkhāroti vucceyya, idamayuttanti🔽dassento “taṇhāsampayutta…pe… jāyatī”ti codeti. Itaro upanissayakoṭi idhādhippetāti
analyzed: yadi sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena tato taṇhāto jāto ti saṅkhāro ti vucceyya idam ayuttanti  dassento taṇhā sampayutta pe jāyati iti codeti itaraḥ idha adhippetā ti
translated: Pointing this out, he asks, “Is it born … associated with craving?” The other party replies that the condition by way of decisive support is intended here.

original: dassento “appahīnattā”ti vatvā “yassa hī”tiādinā tamatthaṃ vivarati. Na hi taṇhāya
analyzed: dassentaḥ appahīna ttā ati vatvā yassa hi iti ādinā tam attham vivarati na hi taṇhāya
translated: Pointing this out, he says, “Because it is not abandoned.” He explains the meaning of this by saying, “For if it were abandoned,” etc. For doubt does not arise when craving is present.

original: vicikicchā sambhavati. Yadi asati sahajātakoṭiyā upanissayakoṭiyā taṇhāpaccayā vicikicchāya🔽sambhavo eva. Diṭṭhiyāpīti dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhiyāpi. Tenāha “catūsu hī”tiādi. Vīsati sakkāyadiṭṭhiyo
analyzed: vicikicchā sambhavati yadi asati sahajāta koṭiyā upanissaya koṭiyā taṇhā paccayā vicikicchāya  eva diṭṭhiyā api iti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyā api tena āha catūsu hi itiādi vīsati sakkāya diṭṭhiyo
translated: If there were no conascent condition, then doubt would arise from craving as a decisive-support condition.

original: sassatadiṭṭhiṃ ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ vicikicchañca pakkhipitvā paccekaṃ aniccatāmukhena
analyzed: sassata diṭṭhim uccheda diṭṭhim vicikicchañca pakkhipitvā paccekam anicca tā mukhena
translated: “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If it were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving” means that if craving were abandoned, doubt would not arise from craving. “If

original: vipassanaṃ dassetvā arahattaṃ pāpetvā desanā niṭṭhāpitāti āha “tevīsatiyā ṭhānesū”tiādi.
analyzed: vipassanam dassetvā arahattam pāpetvā desanā niṭṭhāpitā ti āha tevīsatiyā ṭhānesu utiādi
translated: Having shown him insight, he established him in Arahantship. The lesson was finished. That is why he said “in twenty-three places” and so on.

original: Pālileyyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pālileyya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Pālileyyaka Sutta is finished.

original: 10. Puṇṇamasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: puṇṇama sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Full-moon Day

original: 82. Dissati apadissatīti deso, kāraṇaṃ, tañca kho ñāpakaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yañhi so jānitukāmo
analyzed: dissati apadissati iti desaḥ kāraṇam tat ca kho ñāpakam daṭṭhabbam yat hi saḥ jānitu kāmo
translated: The place is what is seen and what will be seen. And that should be taken as the reason. For what he wants to know

original: ruppanādisabhāvaṃ, paṭhamaṃ pana sarūpaṃ pucchitvā puna tassa viseso pucchitabboti🔽paṭhamaṃ “ime nu kho”tiādinā pucchaṃ karoti, idhāpi ca so viseso eva tassa bhikkhuno
analyzed: ruppana ādi sabhāvam paṭhamam pana sarūpam pucchitvā puna tassa viseso pucchitabbo ti  paṭhamam ime nu kha iti ādinā puccham karoti idha api ca so visesaḥ eva tassa bhikkhuno
translated: is the state of arising, etc. But first he asks about the general nature, and then he can ask about the particular.🔽So he asks the question in the first place with the words “What are these?” Here too he shows that the particular is in the bhikkhu’s

original: antanti dasseti. Ajānanto viya pucchati tesaṃ hetunti adhippāyo.🔽Taṇhāchandamūlakā pabhavattā. Pañcupādānakkhandhāti ettha visesato taṇhupādānassa
analyzed: anta nti dasseti a jānantaḥ viya pucchati tesam hetunti adhippāyaḥ  taṇhā chanda mūlakā pabhava tā pañca upādāna kkhandhā ti ettha visesataḥ taṇhā upādānassa
translated: self. The intention is that he asks as if he did not know the reason for that.🔽Because they originate with craving and will. “The five aggregates as objects of clinging”: here the word “craving” is mentioned specifically,

original: gahaṇaṃ itarassa taggahaṇeneva gahitaṃ tadavinābhāvatoti chandarāgo eva uddhaṭo.
analyzed: gahaṇam itarassa tad gahaṇena iva gahitam tad avinābhāvataḥ ti chanda rāgaḥ eva uddhaṭaḥ
translated: but the word “clinging” includes the other three, since they are inseparable from craving. So only will and lust are mentioned.

original: Idanti tappañhapaṭikkhipanaṃ. Yadipi khandhā upādānehi asahajātāpi honti upādānassa
analyzed: idam ti tad pañha paṭikkhipanam yadi pi khandhāḥ upādānehi asahajātāḥ api honti upādānassa
translated: “This” refers to the rejection of the question about austerity. Although the aggregates are not conascent with the clingings and are not their objects,

original: anārammaṇabhūtāpi, upādānaṃ pana tehi sahajātameva, tadārammaṇañca hotiyevāti dasseti.
analyzed: anārammaṇa bhūtā api upādānam pana tehi sahajātam eva tad ārammaṇam ca dasseti
translated: clinging is conascent with them and has them as its object. This is what is shown.

original: Na hi asahajātaṃ anārammaṇañca upādānaṃ atthīti. Idāni tamatthaṃ vivaritvā dassetuṃ
analyzed: na hi asahajātam anārammaṇam ca upādānam atthi iti idāni tam attham vivaritvā dassetuṃ
translated: For there is no clinging that is not conascent with or that does not have as its object the aggregates. Now, in order to demonstrate and reveal this meaning,

original: “taṇhāsampayuttasmi”ntiādi vuttaṃ, taṃ suviññeyyameva. Ārammaṇatoti ārammaṇakaraṇato.🔽“Evaṃrūpo siya”nti evaṃpavattassa chandarāgassa “evaṃvedano siya”nti evaṃpavattiyā🔽abhāvato tattha tattheva natasaṅkhārā bhijjanti, tasmā rūpavedanārammaṇānaṃ chandarāgādīnaṃ
analyzed: taṇhā sampayuttasmin tiādi vuttam tam su viññeyyam eva ārammaṇato ti ārammaṇa karaṇato  evaṃrūpaḥ siyanti evaṃpavattassa chanda rāgassa evaṃvedanaḥ siyanti evaṃpavattiyā  abhāvataḥ tattha tattha iva nata saṅkhārāḥ bhijjanti tasmā rūpa vedanā ārammaṇānam chanda rāga ādīnam
translated: “In what is associated with craving” and so on is said. This is quite clear. “By way of object” means by way of making an object.🔽“He might be of such form” means that the formations of non-existence break up right there, since there is no occurrence of the desire and lust that would occur thus, “He might be of such feeling.” Therefore,

original: abhāvato attheva chandarāgavemattatā. Chandarāgassa pahānādivasena chandarāgapaṭisaṃyuttassa
analyzed: abhāvataḥ atthā iva chanda rāga vematta tā chanda rāgassa pahāna ādi vasena chanda rāga paṭisaṃyuttassa
translated: since there is no desire and lust for the form and feeling that are their objects, there is indeed diversity of desire and lust.🔽Since the question is not asked in terms of the abandoning of desire and lust, etc.,

original: apucchitattā, “anusandhi na ghaṭiyatī”ti vuttaṃ. Kiñcāpi na ghaṭiyatīti aññasseva
analyzed: a pucchita ttā anusandhi na ghaṭiyati iti vuttam kiñcā api na ghaṭiyati iti aññassa eva
translated: “the connection does not hold.” Although it does not hold,

original: pucchitattā, tathāpi sānusandhikāva pucchā, tato eva sānusandhikaṃ vissajjanaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: pucchita ttā tathā api sa anusandhikā ava pucchā tatas eva sa anusandhikam vissajjanam
translated: and the question is asked in this way, still the question is with a sequel, and the answer is with a sequel accordingly. Herein,

original: kāraṇamāha “tesaṃ tesa”ntiādinā. Tena ajjhāsayānusandhivasena sānusandhikāneva pucchāvissajjanānīti dasseti.
analyzed: kāraṇam āha tesam tesanti ādinā tena ajjhāsayā anusandhi vasena sa anusandhikāni eva pucchā vissajjanāni iti dasseti
translated: he gives the reason with “For each of these” , and so on. He shows that the question and the answer are with a sequel only in the sense of a sequel in the way of a train of thought.

original: Puṇṇamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: puṇṇama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Puṇṇamāsutta is ended.

original: Khajjanīyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽9. Theravaggo
analyzed: khajjanīya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  thera vaggo
translated: The commentary on the Khajjanīyavagga is ended.🔽The Chapter of Elders

original: 1. Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Ānandasutta

original: 83. Paṭiccāti nissayaṃ katvā. “Esohamasmī”ti diṭṭhiggāho, “seyyohamasmī”ti mānaggāho🔽ca taṇhāvaseneva hontīti taṇhāpi tathāpavattiyā paccayabhūtā tathāpavatti evāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: paṭicca ati nissayam katvā esā uham asmi iti diṭṭhi ggāho seyyā uham asmi iti māna ggāho  ca taṇhā vasena iva honti iti taṇhā api tathāpavattiyā paccaya bhūtā tathāpavatti eva ati vuttam
translated: “Having made it a support”: having made it a dependence. The assumption “I am this” is a conceit of views, and the assumption “I am better” is a conceit of conceit.

original: “asmīti evaṃ pavattaṃ taṇhāmānadiṭṭhipapañcattayaṃ hotī”ti. Daharasaddo bāladārakepi
analyzed: asmi iti evam pavattam taṇhā māna diṭṭhi papañcattayam hoti iti dahara saddaḥ bāla dārake pi
translated: They are due to craving, and so craving is a condition for their occurrence in this way, and so they are said to be “the triple occurrence of craving, conceit, and views as ‘I am’ that occurs in this way.”🔽The word “young” is used of foolish boys,

original: pavattatīti tato visesanatthaṃ “yuvā”ti vuttaṃ. Yuvāpi eko amaṇḍanasīloti tato visesanatthaṃ
analyzed: pavattati iti tatas visesana attham yuvā iti vuttam yuvā api ekaḥ a maṇḍana sīlaḥ ti tatas visesana attham
translated: and so “youth” is said in order to distinguish . A youth may be one who is not given to adornment, and so “handsome” is said in order to distinguish .

original: “maṇḍanakajātiko”ti vuttaṃ. Tena mukhanimittapaccavekkhaṇassa sabbhāvaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: maṇḍanaka jātikaḥ iti vuttam tena mukha nimitta paccavekkhaṇassa sabbhāvam dasseti
translated: “It is of the nature of a reflection” is said. By that he shows the true nature of the contemplation of the face-sign.

original: Tanti ādāsamaṇḍalaṃ olokayato. Parammukhaṃ hutvā paññāyeyyāti yadi puratthimadisābhimukhaṃ
analyzed: tanti ādāsa maṇḍalam olokayato parammukham hutvā paññāyeyyāti yadi puratthima disā abhimukham
translated: “If it were to appear as though facing away from him” means: if it were to stand facing the eastern direction,

original: hutvā ṭhitaṃ, mukhanimittampi puratthimadisābhimukhameva hutvā paññāyeyyāti attho.
analyzed: hutvā ṭhitam mukha nimittam pi puratthima disa abhimukham eva hutvā paññāyeyya ati attho
translated: then the meaning is that the face-sign would also appear as though facing the eastern direction.

original: Yadipi parassa sadisassa mukhaṃ bhaveyya, tathāpi kāci asadisatā bhaveyyāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: yadi api parassa sadisassa mukham bhaveyya tathā api kāci asadisa tā bhaveyya ati vuttam
translated: Even though the face would be similar to another’s, still there would be some dissimilarity. Thus it is said:

original: “vaṇṇādīhi asadisaṃ hutvā paññāyeyyā”ti. Nibhāsarūpanti paṭibhāsarūpaṃ. Nibhāsarūpaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇa ādīhi asadisam hutvā paññāyeyya ati nibhāsa rūpam ti paṭibhāsa rūpam nibhāsa rūpam
translated: “It would appear as though dissimilar in colour, etc.” “The appearance of a reflection” means the appearance of a reflection-image.

original: tāva kaṃsādimaye pabhassare maṇḍale paññāyatu, udake pana kathanti “kena kāraṇenā”ti
analyzed: tāva kaṃsa ādi maye pabhassare maṇḍale paññāyatu udake pana kathanti kena kāraṇena ati
translated: Let the appearance of a reflection-image be in a bright mirror, etc., but how is it in water? Thus he asks: “For what reason?”

original: pucchati. Itaro “mahābhūtānaṃ visuddhatāyā”ti vadanto tatthāpi yathāladdhapabhassarabhāvenevāti
analyzed: pucchati itaraḥ mahābhūtānam visuddha tāya ati vadanto tattha api yathā laddha pabhassara bhāvena iva ati
translated: The other replies: “Because of the purity of the primary elements.” By that he shows that even there it is by means of the brightness obtained in that way.

original: dasseti. Ettha ca maṇḍanajātiko puriso viya puthujjano, ādāsatalādayo viya pañcakkhandhā,
analyzed: dassa iti ettha ca maṇḍana jātiko purisaḥ viya puthujjanaḥ ādāsa tala ādayaḥ viya pañca kkhandhāḥ
translated: And here the worldling is like the man who is of the nature of a reflector; the five aggregates are like the surface of a mirror, etc.;

original: mukhanimittaṃ viya “asmī”ti gahaṇaṃ, mukhanimittaṃ upādāya dissamānarūpādi viya “asmī”ti
analyzed: mukha nimittam viya asmi iti gahaṇam mukha nimittam upādāya dissamāna rūpa ādi asmi iti
translated: The apprehension of “I am” is like the sign of the face. The various modes of apprehension such as “I am,” “I am this,” “I am the other,” are like the visible data, etc., that are seen in dependence on the sign of the face.

original: sati “ahamasmī”ti “parosmī”tiādayo gāhavisesā. Abhisametoti abhisamito, ayameva vā pāṭho.
analyzed: sati aham asmi iti paraḥ asmi iti ādayaḥ gāha visesāḥ abhisametaḥ iti abhisamitaḥ ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: “Is conceived” : is conceived of, or the reading may be abhisamito .

original: Ānandasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ānanda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Ānanda Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Tissasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tissa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Tissamahāsāmaṇera Sutta

original: 84. Madhurakaṃ vuccati kāye vibhāranti āha – “madhurakajāto viyāti sañjātagarubhāvo
analyzed: madhurakam vuccati kāye āha madhuraka jātaḥ viyāti sañjāta garu bhāvaḥ
translated: “Sweet-toned” : it is said that he was sweet-toned. “As if he had just been born” : he had just acquired dignity.

original: viyā”ti. Garubhāve sati lahutā anokāsāva, tathā mudutā kammaññatā cāti vuttaṃ “akammañño”ti.
analyzed: viyā ti garu bhāve sati lahu tā tathā mudu tā kammañña tā ca ati vuttam akammaññaḥ ti
translated: When there is dignity, lightness is out of place, and so too softness and wieldiness. That is why it is said “unwieldy” .

original: “Kāye”ti ānetvā vattabbaṃ. Na pakkhāyantīti pakāsā hutvā na khāyanti. Tenāha “na🔽pākaṭā hontī”ti. Upaṭṭhahantīti upatiṭṭhanti. Na dissatīti gahaṇaṃ na gacchati. Mahāvicikicchāti
analyzed: kāye iti ānetvā vattabbam na pakkhāyanti iti pakāsā hutvā na khāyanti tena āha na  pākaṭāḥ honti iti upaṭṭhahanti iti upatiṭṭhanti na dissati iti gahaṇam na gacchati mahāvicikicchā ati
translated: “In the body” : this should be supplied. “Do not appear” : they do not appear as if they were shining. Hence he said “are not evident” .

original: aṭṭhavatthukā soḷasavatthukā ca vimati. Na hi uppajjati paripakkakusalamūlattā.
analyzed: aṭṭha vatthukā soḷasa vatthukā ca vimati na hi uppajjati paripakka kusala mūla ttā
translated: “Are present” : are present. “Is not seen” : is not apprehended. “Great doubt” : indecision about the eight and sixteen bases. It does not arise because his wholesome roots are ripe.

original: Kāmānametaṃ adhivacananti padaṃ uddharitvā yena adhippāyena bhagavatā ninnaṃ pallalaṃ kāmānaṃ nidassanabhāvena ābhataṃ, taṃ adhippāyaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kāmānam etam adhivacanam ti padam uddharitvā yena adhippāyena bhagavatā ninnam pallalam kāmānam nidassana bhāvena ābhatam tam adhippāyam vibhāvetum yathā hi itiādi vuttam
translated: The word “sign” is extracted from the passage, “This is a designation for sensual desires,” and the following is stated in order to show the intention with which the Blessed One used the word “sign” to illustrate sensual desires as a swamp.

original: Tissasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tissa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Tissa Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Yamakasuttavaṇṇanā🔽85. Diṭṭhi eva diṭṭhigataṃ “gūthagataṃ muttagata”nti yathā. Diṭṭhigataṃ nāma jātaṃ khandhavinimuttassa sattassa gahitattā.
analyzed: yamaka sutta vaṇṇanā  diṭṭhi eva diṭṭhi gatam gūtha gatam mutta gatam ti yathā diṭṭhi gatam nāma jātam khandha vinimuttassa sattassa gahita ttā
translated: The Twin Miracle Sutta🔽A view is also a “view-point” in the sense of “a place for excrement,” “a place for urine.” A view-point is a term for a view because it is the grasping of a self apart from the aggregates.

original: Kupiteti diṭṭhisaṅkhātarogena kupite. Paggayhāti tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike viya therassa
analyzed: kupita iti diṭṭhi saṅkhāta rogena kupite paggayha ati tesam bhikkhūnam santike viya therassa
translated: “When they were angry”: when they were angry with the disease called a view.

original: sāriputtassa sammukhā attano laddhiṃ paggayha “evaṃ khvāha”nti evaṃ nicchayena vattuṃ asakkonto.
analyzed: sāriputtassa sammukhā attanaḥ laddhim paggayha evam evam nicchayena vattum a sakkontaḥ
translated: “They could not prevail over him”: he could not prevail over the Elder Sāriputta, as if in his presence, by saying, “This is my view” and insisting on it.

original: Anuyogavattaṃ nāma yena yutto, tassa attano gāhaṃ nijjhānakkhantiyāva yāthāvato pavedanaṃ.
analyzed: anuyogavattam nāma yena yuttaḥ tassa attanaḥ gāham nijjhāna kkhantiyā ava yāthāvataḥ pavedanam
translated: “The method of cross-questioning”: the method by which one who is engaged in it makes known to another his own grasping and his own opinion according to reality.

original: Therassa anuyoge bhummanti “taṃ kiṃ maññasi, āvuso yamakā”tiādinā therena kathitapucchāya
analyzed: therassa anuyoge bhummanti tam kim maññasi āvuso yamakāti ādinā therena kathita pucchāya
translated: The meaning of “he was unable to stand against the Elder’s questioning” is that he was unable to stand against the questioning stated by the Elder in the words “What do you think, friend Yamaka?”🔽The meaning of “the description of the inability to stand against” is this.

original: bhummaniddeso. Sace taṃ āvusoti idanti “sace taṃ, āvuso”ti evamādikaṃ idaṃ vacanaṃ.🔽Etanti yamakattheraṃ. Aññanti arahattaṃ. Vattabbākārena vadanto atthato arahattaṃ
analyzed: bhumma niddeso sace tam āvuso ti idam ti sace tam āvuso ti evamādikam idam vacanam  etat ti yamaka ttheram aññan ti arahattam vattabba ākārena vadantaḥ atthataḥ arahattam
translated: The words “If, friend” , etc., are this statement.🔽The meaning of “that” is the Elder Yamaka.🔽The meaning of “another” is Arahantship.

original: byākaronto nāma hotīti adhippāyena vadati.
analyzed: byākarontaḥ nāma hoti iti adhippāyena vadati
translated: The meaning of “he was declaring Arahantship” is that he was declaring it in the sense of the expression “he was declaring it in the words of the expression.”

original: Etassa paṭhamamaggassāti etassa idāniyeva tiparivaṭṭadesanāvasāne tayā adhigatassa
analyzed: etassa paṭhama maggassa ati etassa idāniyā iva ti parivaṭṭa desanā avasāne tayā adhigatassa
translated: The meaning of “of this first path” is of this first path that you have now just attained with the conclusion of the teaching in the three turnings.

original: paṭhamamaggassa. Catūhi yogehīti attato piyato udāsinato veritoti catūhipi uppajjanaanatthayogehi.
analyzed: paṭhama maggassa catūhi yogehi iti attataḥ piyataḥ udāsinataḥ catūhi pi uppajjana anattha yogehi
translated: The meaning of “by the four yokes” is by the four yokes of origination, namely, as self, as dear, as neutral, and as hostile.

original: Upetīti taṇhupayadiṭṭhupayehi upādiyati taṇhādiṭṭhivatthuṃ pappoti. Upādiyatīti daḷhaggāhaṃ
analyzed: upeti iti taṇhā upaya diṭṭhupayehi upādiyati taṇhā diṭṭhi vatthum pappoti upādiyati iti daḷhaggāham
translated: The meaning of “he would be clinging” is that he would be clinging with craving and views, he would reach the bases of craving and views. The meaning of “he would be grasping” is that he would grasp firmly.

original: gaṇhāti. Adhitiṭṭhatīti abhinivissa tiṭṭhati. Kinti? “Attā me”ti. Paccatthikā me
analyzed: gaṇhāti adhitiṭṭhati iti abhinivissa tiṭṭhati kinti attā me iti paccatthikā me
translated: The meaning of “he would be standing upon” is that he would stand upon it by misapprehending it. What? “My self.”🔽The meaning of “he would be standing upon it as an enemy” is that he would stand upon it by misapprehending it as an enemy.

original: eteti ete rūpavedanādayo pañcupādānakkhandhā mayhaṃ paccatthikā anatthāvahattāti
analyzed: ete iti ete rūpa vedanā ādayaḥ pañca upādānakkhandhāḥ mayham paccatthikāḥ anattha āvaha ttā ati
translated: “These”: these five aggregates as objects of clinging, namely, form, feeling, etc., are my enemies, my harm-doers.

original: vipassanāñāṇena ñatvā. Vipassanāya yojetvāti vipassanāya khandhe yojetvā.
analyzed: vipassanā ñāṇena ñatvā vipassanāya yojetvā ati vipassanāya khandhe yojetvā
translated: “Having known with the knowledge of insight”: having known with the insight knowledge. “Having applied insight”: having applied insight to the aggregates.

original: Yamakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yamaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Twin Verses is finished.

original: 4. Anurādhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anurādha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Discourse on Anurādha

original: 86. Tasseva vihārassāti mahāvane yasmiṃ vihāre bhagavā viharati, tasseva vihārassa.
analyzed: tassa iva vihārassa ati mahā vane yasmin vihāre bhagavā viharati tassa iva vihārassa
translated: “In that same dwelling place”: in that same dwelling place in the Great Wood where the Blessed One was dwelling.

original: Imeti aññatitthiyā. Yasmā ayaṃ thero ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ ṭhapanīyabhāvena na ṭhapesi,
analyzed: ime ti añña titthiyāḥ yasmai ayam theraḥ ṭhapanīyam pañham ṭhapanīya bhāvena na ṭhapesi
translated: “These”: the sectarians. Since this elder did not set aside the question that should be set aside as one that should be set aside,

original: tasmā. Aññatitthiyā…pe… etadavocuṃ. Tenāha “ekadesena sāsanasamayaṃ jānantā”ti.🔽Gahitameva hoti tato pageva siddhattā. Tenāha “tassa mūlattā”ti. Evanti “dukkhañceva🔽paññapemi, dukkhassa ca nirodha”nti evaṃ. Vaṭṭavivaṭṭamevāti pañcannaṃ pana khandhānaṃ
analyzed: tasmai etat avocum tena āha eka desena sāsana samayam jānantā iti  gahitam eva hoti tato pagā iva siddha ttā tena āha tassa mūla ttā ti evanti dukkham ca iva  paññapemi dukkhassa ca nirodhanti evam vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam eva ati pañcannam pana khandhānam
translated: therefore the sectarians … said this to him. Hence it was said above: “knowing the occasion for the Dispensation in part” .🔽is already included, since it is established by that. Hence it was said above: “because it is the root of that” . “Thus”: I describe suffering

original: samanupassanāya vasena vaṭṭaṃ, “evaṃ passa”ntiādinā vivaṭṭaṃ kathitameva.
analyzed: samanupassanāya vasena vaṭṭam evam passanti ādinā vivaṭṭam kathitam eva
translated: and the cessation of suffering. “The round and the penetration”: the round is stated by way of the contemplation of the five aggregates, and the penetration is stated by “Contemplate thus” , etc.

original: Anurādhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anurādha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Anurādhasutta is finished.

original: 5. Vakkalisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vakkali sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Vakkali-sutta

original: 87. Nagaramajjhe mahāābādho uppajjīti nagaramajjhena āgacchanto kammasamuṭṭhāno mahanto
analyzed: nagara majjhe mahā ābādhaḥ uppajji iti nagara majjhena āgacchanto kamma samuṭṭhāno mahanto
translated: A great sickness arose in the middle of the town: a great sickness arose, originating from kamma, as he was coming through the middle of the town.

original: ābādho uppajjati. Samantato adhosīti sabbabhāgena paripphandi. Iriyāpathaṃ yāpetunti
analyzed: ābādhaḥ uppajjati samantataḥ sabba bhāgena paripphandi iriyāpatham yāpetunti
translated: It spread all around: it spread in all directions.🔽To carry on the postures: to carry on the postures of lying down, sitting, etc.

original: sayananisajjādibhedaṃ iriyāpathaṃ pavattetuṃ. Nivattantīti osakkanti, parihāyantīti
analyzed: sayana nisajja ādi bhedam iriyāpatham pavattetum nivattanti iti osakkanti parihāyanti iti
translated: They turned back: they turned away, the meaning is, they declined.

original: attho. Adhigacchantīti vaḍḍhanti. Satthu guṇasarīraṃ nāma navavidhalokuttaradhammādhigamamūlanti
analyzed: atthaḥ adhigacchanti iti vaḍḍhanti satthu guṇa sarīram nāma navavidha lokuttara dhamma adhigama mūlanti
translated: They attained: they increased. The Master’s body of special qualities is called the attainment of the nine supramundane states.

original: katvā vuttaṃ “navavidho hi…pe… kāyo nāmā”ti, yathā sattānaṃ kāyo paṭisandhimūlako.
analyzed: katvā vuttam navavidhaḥ hipe kāyaḥ nāma ati yathā sattānam kāyo paṭisandhi mūlako
translated: It is said that “the body is of nine kinds, etc.,” just as the body of beings is rooted in rebirth-linking.🔽The dwelling built at Black Rock is the Black Rock Dwelling.

original: Kāḷasilāyaṃ katavihāro kāḷasilāvihāro. Maggavimokkhatthāyāti aggamaggavimokkhādhigamāya.
analyzed: kāḷasilāyam kata vihāraḥ kāḷasilā vihāraḥ magga vimokkha atthāya ati agga magga vimokkha adhigamāya
translated: For the sake of the path and deliverance: for the sake of attaining the supreme path and deliverance.🔽The deities: deities of the Pure Abodes.

original: Devatāti suddhāvāsadevatā. Alāmakaṃ nāma puthujjanakālakiriyāya abhāvato. Tenāha
analyzed: devatā ati suddhāvāsa devatā alāmakam nāma puthujjana kāla kiriyāya tena āha
translated: The Blessed One’s passing away was not due to the death of an ordinary man. Therefore it is said:

original: “thero kirā”tiādi. Ekaṃ dve ñāṇānīti ekaṃ dve paccavekkhaṇañāṇāni sabhāvato avassaṃ
analyzed: thero kirāti ādi ekam dve ñāṇāni iti ekam dve paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇāni sabhāvataḥ
translated: “The Elder so-and-so … ” and so on. “One or two kinds of knowledge”: one or two kinds of reviewing knowledge.

original: uppajjanti, ayaṃ dhammatā. Maggaphalanibbānapaccavekkhaṇāni taṃtaṃmaggavuṭṭhāne uppajjanti
analyzed: uppajjanti ayam dhamma tā magga phala nibbāna paccavekkhaṇāni taṃ taṃ magga vuṭṭhāne uppajjanti
translated: This is the rule. Reviewing of path, fruition, and Nibbāna arise only when the respective paths are being reviewed.

original: eva. Ekaṃ dveti vacanaṃ uppannabhāvadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: eva ekam dve iti vacanam uppanna bhāva dassana attham vuttam
translated: The words “one or two” are said in order to show that they arise.

original: Dhūmāyanabhāvo dhūmākāratā, tathā timirāyanabhāvo.
analyzed: dhūmāyana bhāvaḥ dhūma ākāra tā tathā timirāyana bhāvaḥ
translated: The state of being smoky is the state of having the appearance of smoke. Likewise, the state of being misty.

original: Vakkalisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vakkali sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Vakkali Sutta is finished.

original: 6. Assajisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: assaji sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Assaji Sutta

original: 88. Passambhitvāti nirodhetvā. No ca svāhanti no ca su ahaṃ. Parihāyi kuppadhammattā.
analyzed: no ca svāhā ati nirodhetvā no ca su aham parihāyi kuppa dhamma ttā
translated: “Having subsided”: having ceased. “Not for myself”: not for my own sake. “It would fail”: it would be destroyed, because of its perishable nature.

original: Etanti samādhimattasāraṃ, sīlamatte pana vattabbameva natthi. Kathaṃ hotīti kathaṃ🔽abhinandanā hoti. Dukkhaṃ patvāti dukkhuppattihetu sukhaṃ pattheti “evaṃ me dukkhapariḷāho
analyzed: etat ti samādhi matta sāram sīla matte pana vattabbam eva na atthi katham hoti iti katham  abhinandanā hoti dukkham patvā ati dukkha uppatti hetu sukham pattheti evam me dukkha pariḷāhaḥ
translated: “That”: the essence of concentration. But there is nothing to be said about the essence of virtue. “How does it come to be … delighting in …”? How does it come to be delighting in?

original: na bhavissatī”ti. Yadaggenāti yena bhāgena. “Dukkhaṃ patthetiyevā”ti vatvā tattha
analyzed: na bhavissati iti yad aggena ati yena bhāgena dukkham vatvā tattha
translated: “Having met with pain”: having met with the cause for the arising of pain, he seeks pleasure, thinking, “In this way my painful affliction will not be.” “In that quarter”: in that direction. “He seeks only pain” is said after that.

original: kāraṇamāha “sukhavipariṇāmena hī”tiādi. Sukhaviparivatte sukhavipariṇāmadukkhaṃ,
analyzed: kāraṇam āha sukha vipariṇāmena hi itiādi sukha viparivatte sukha vipariṇāma dukkham
translated: He gives the reason: “Because of the change-of-pleasure, etc.” The pain that arises from the change-of-pleasure is called “change-of-pleasure-pain” .

original: tasmā sukhaṃ abhinandanto atthato dukkhaṃ abhinandati nāma.
analyzed: tasmā sukham abhinandantaḥ atthataḥ dukkham abhinandati nāma
translated: Therefore, one who delights in pleasure is said to delight in pain in reality.

original: Assajisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: assaji sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Assaji Sutta is finished.

original: 7. Khemakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khemaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Khemaka Sutta

original: 89. Attaniyanti diṭṭhigatikaparikappitassa attano santakaṃ. Tenāha “attano parikkhārajāta”nti.
analyzed: attaniyam ti diṭṭhi gatika parikappitassa attano santakam tena āha attano parikkhāra jātanti
translated: “His own” : what belongs to the self imagined by the theorists. Therefore, the text says: “what belongs to his own belongings.”

original: Taṇhāmāno adhigato arahattassa anadhigatattā, no diṭṭhimāno adhigato, tathā kāmarāgabyāpādāpi.
analyzed: taṇhā mānaḥ adhigataḥ arahattassa an adhigata ttā no diṭṭhi mānaḥ adhigataḥ tathā kāma rāga byāpādā api
translated: He had not yet attained the conceit “I am” based on craving and conceit, nor the conceit “I am” based on views, nor sensual lust and ill will.

original: Anāgāmī kira khemakatthero, “sakadāgāmī”ti keci vadanti. Sandhāvanikāyāti sañcaraṇena.🔽Tenāha “punappunaṃ gamanāgamanenā”ti. Catukkhattuṃ gamanāgamanenāti catukkhattuṃ
analyzed: anāgāmī kira khemaka tthero sakadāgāmī iti keci vadanti sandhāvanikāya ati sañcaraṇena  tena āha punappunam gamana āgamanena ati catu khattum gamana āgamanena ati catu khattum
translated: The Elder Khemaka was an Anāgāmī, some say a Sakadāgāmī. “Wandering about” : by moving about.🔽Therefore, the text says: “by going and coming again and again.” “Four times” :

original: gamanena ca āgamanena ca. Tenāha – “taṃ divasaṃ dviyojanaṃ addhānaṃ āhiṇḍī”ti. Ñatvāti
analyzed: gamanena ca āgamanena ca tena āha tam divasam dvi yojanam addhānam āhiṇḍi iti ñatvā iti
translated: four times by going and four times by coming. Therefore, the text says: “he went a distance of two leagues that day.” “Having known” :

original: ajjhāsayaṃ ñatvā. Theroti khemakatthero.
analyzed: ajjhāsayam ñatvā thero ti khemaka thero
translated: having known his intention. “The Elder” : the Elder Khemaka.

original: Rūpameva asmīti vadatīti rūpakkhandhameva “asmī”ti gāhassa vatthuṃ katvā vadati. Adhigato taṇhāmāno.
analyzed: rūpam eva asmi iti vadati iti rūpa kkhandham eva asmi iti gāhassa vatthum katvā vadati adhigataḥ taṇhā māno
translated: He says “I am only form”: he says this making the form-aggregate the basis for the assumption “I am.” Craving and conceit are abandoned.

original: Aṇusahagatoti aṇubhāvaṃ gato. Tenāha “sukhumo”ti. Tayo khārā viya tisso anupassanā cittasaṃkilesassa visodhanato. Sīlagandhādīhi guṇagandhehi.🔽Kathetunti uddesavasena kathetuṃ. Pakāsetunti niddesavasena tamatthaṃ pakāsetuṃ.🔽Jānāpetunti kāraṇavasena jānāpetuṃ. Patiṭṭhāpetunti kathāpetuṃ. Vivaṭaṃ kātunti udāharaṇaṃ
analyzed: aṇu sahagataḥ ti aṇu bhāvam gataḥ tena āha sukhumaḥ ti tayo khārāḥ viya tisso anupassanā citta saṃkilesassa visodhanato sīla gandha ādīhi guṇa gandhehi  kathetum ti uddesa vasena kathetum pakāsetum ti niddesa vasena tam attham pakāsetum  kāraṇa vasena jānāpetum patiṭṭhāpetum ti kathāpetum vivaṭam kātum ti udāharaṇam
translated: “Subtle”: become subtle. Hence it is said, “fine.” The three kinds of “roughness” are the three contemplations.🔽“To teach”: to teach by way of the summary. “To expound”: to expound the meaning by way of the exposition.

original: vaṇṇetvā pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ. Suvibhattaṃ kātunti anvayato byatirekato suṭṭhu, vibhattaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇetvā pākaṭam kātum su vibhattam kātum ti anvayataḥ byatirekataḥ suṭṭhu vibhattam
translated: “To make known”: to make known by way of the reason. “To establish”: to make known by way of the teaching. “To make clear”: having described, to make it clear by way of the illustration.🔽“To make it well-analyzed”: to make it well-analyzed by way of the general and particular.

original: kātuṃ. Uttānakaṃ kātunti upanayanigamehi tamatthaṃ vibhūtaṃ kātuṃ. Aññena nīhārenāti
analyzed: kātum uttānakam kātum ti upanaya nigamehi tam attham vibhūtam kātum aññena nīhārena ati
translated: “To make it evident”: to make the meaning evident by way of the conclusion. “By another method”:

original: vipassanāvimuttena cittābhinīhārena.
analyzed: vipassanā vimuttena citta abhinīhārena
translated: by the method of insight-deliverance.

original: Khemakasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khemaka sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Khemaka Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Channasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: channa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Channa Sutta

original: 90. Makkhīti guṇamakkhanalakkhaṇena makkhena samannāgato. Paḷāsīti yugaggāhalakkhaṇena paḷāsena samannāgato. Etaṃ avocāti “ovadantu maṃ…pe… passeyya”nti etaṃ avoca.
analyzed: makkhī iti guṇa makkhana lakkhaṇena makkhena samannāgato paḷāsī iti yuga ggāha lakkhaṇena paḷāsena samannāgataḥ etam avoca ati ovadantu maṃ pe passeyyanti etam avoca
translated: Makkhi means possessed of the characteristic of disparaging good qualities. Palasi means possessed of the characteristic of grasping the yoke. Etaṃ avocā ti “ovadantu maṃ bhante therā, anusāsantu maṃ bhante therā, appeva nāma labheyyāma therānaṃ dhammadesanāya dassanaṃ” ti etaṃ avocā ti attho.

original: Theranti channattheraṃ. Attano duggahaṇena kañci upārambhampi kareyya. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: theram ti channa ttheram attanaḥ duggahaṇena kañci upārambham pi kareyya tena vuttam
translated: Therā ti channattherā. Attano duggahaṇena kañci upārambhampi kareyya. Tena vuttaṃ

original: “evaṃ kira nesaṃ ahosī”tiādi. Niddosamevassa katvāti ādito anurūpattameva katvā saddhammaṃ kathessāmāti.
analyzed: evam kira nesam ahosi itiādi niddosam eva assa katvā iti āditas anurūpattam eva katvā saddhammam kathessāma ati
translated: “evaṃ kira nesaṃ ahosī” ti ādinā. Niddosamevassa katvā ti ādito anurūpattameva katvā saddhammaṃ kathessāmā ti.

original: Paritassanā upādānanti bhayaparitassanā diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Anattani sati anattakatāni
analyzed: paritassanā upādānanti bhaya paritassanā diṭṭha upādānam anattani sati anatta katāni
translated: Paritassanā upādānā ti bhayaparitassanā diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Anattani sati anattakatāni

original: kammāni kamattānaṃ phusissantīti bhayaparitassanā ceva diṭṭhupādānañca uppajjati.
analyzed: kammāni kamattānam phusissanti iti bhaya paritassanā ca iva diṭṭhupādānam ca uppajjati
translated: kammāni kamattānaṃ phusissantī ti bhayaparitassanā ceva diṭṭhupādānañca uppajjati.

original: Paṭinivattatīti yathāraddhavipassanāto paṭinivattati, nāsakkhīti attho. Kasmā panetassa
analyzed: paṭinivattati iti yathā āraddha vipassanātaḥ paṭinivattati na asakkhi iti attho kasmā pana etassa
translated: Paṭinivattatī ti yathāraddhavipassanāto paṭinivattati, nāsakkhī ti attho. Kasmā panetassa

original: vipassanamanuyuñjantassa evaṃ ahosīti tattha kāraṇaṃ vadati “ayaṃ kirā”tiādinā. Evanti
analyzed: vipassanam anuyuñjantassa evam ahosi iti tattha kāraṇam vadati ayam kirāti ādinā evam ti
translated: vipassanamanuyuñjantassa evaṃ ahosī ti tattha kāraṇaṃ vadati “ayaṃ kira” ti ādinā. Evanti

original: “ko nu kho me attā”ti evaṃ na hoti. Tāvatikā vissatthīti “mayhaṃ dhammaṃ desetū”ti🔽vuttavissāso atthīti attho. Idaṃ kaccānasatthaṃ addasāti yojanā. “Dvayanissito, kaccāna,
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho me attā ati evam na hoti tāvatikā vissatthī iti mayham dhammam desetu uti  vutta vissāsaḥ atthi iti atthaḥ idam kaccāna sattham addasā ati yojanā dvaya nissitaḥ kaccāna
translated: “Who is my self?” It is not like that. The confidence is just that much. The meaning is: “I have the confidence to say ‘Teach me the Dhamma.’ ” The interpretation is: “He saw the Kaccana brahmin.”🔽🔽

original: loko”tiādi diṭṭhiviniveṭhanā. “Ete te, kaccāna, ubho ante anupagammā”tiādi buddhabaladīpanā.
analyzed: loka uti ādi diṭṭhi viniveṭhanā ete te ubho ante buddha bala dīpanā
translated: “Who is my self?” is not. The confidence is just that much. The meaning is: “I have the confidence to say ‘Teach me the Dhamma.’ ” The interpretation is: “He saw Kaccana’s doctrine.” “The world, Kaccana, is dependent for support” , etc., is the turning back of views. “Avoiding both these extremes, the Tathagata teaches you a doctrine by the middle” , etc., is the demonstration of the Buddha’s power.

original: Channasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: channa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Channa sutta is ended.

original: 9-10. Rāhulasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: rāhula sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Rāhula sutta, etc.

original: 91-92. Etāni suttāni. Idhāgatānīti imasmiṃ vagge ānītāni saṅgītikārehīti.
analyzed: etāni suttāni idha āgatāni iti imasmin vagge ānītāni saṅgīti kārehi iti
translated: These suttas are brought here, brought into this chapter, by the compilers of the canon.

original: Rāhulasuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: rāhula sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Rāhula sutta, etc., is ended.

original: Theravaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: thera vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Theravagga is ended.

original: 10. Pupphavaggo
analyzed: puppha vaggaḥ
translated: The Flower Basket

original: 1. Nadīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nadī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The River Sutta

original: 93. Pabbateyyāti pabbatato āgatā. Tato eva ohārinī. Tenassā caṇḍasotataṃ dasseti. Dūraṃ gacchatīti dūraṅgamā. Tenassā mahoghataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: pabbateyyā ati pabbatataḥ āgatā tatas eva ohārinī tena assā caṇḍa sota tam dasseti dūram gacchati iti dūraṅgamā tena assāḥ mahogha tam dasseti
translated: “From the mountain” : come from the mountain. “Flowing down” : flowing down from there. This shows that its current is swift. “Goes far” : goes a long way. This shows that it has a great volume of water.

original: Soteti vaṭṭasote. Catūhi gāhehīti “rūpaṃ attato samanupassatī”tiādinayappavattehi catūhi gāhehi. Palujjanattāti chinnattā. Sokādibyasanappattīti sokādianatthuppatti.
analyzed: sotā iti vaṭṭa sote catūhi gāhehi iti rūpam attataḥ samanupassati iti ādi naya ppavattehi catūhi gāhehi palujjana ttā ati chinna ttā soka ādi byasana ppatti iti soka ādi anattha uppatti
translated: “In the stream” : in the round of rebirths. “With the four graspings” : with the four graspings beginning with the grasping of the view “Material form is self” . “Because of its breaking up” : because of its being cut off. “Because of the occurrence of sorrow, etc.” : because of the occurrence of the misfortune of sorrow, etc.

original: Nadīsuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nadī sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the River Suttas is finished.

original: 2. Pupphasuttavaṇṇanā🔽94. Vivadatīti vivādaṃ karoti. Vadantoti ayathāsabhāvena vadanto. Vivadati dhammatāya
analyzed: puppha sutta vaṇṇanā  vivadati iti vivādam karoti vadanto ti ayathā sabhāvena vadantaḥ vivadati dhamma tāya
translated: The Flower Sutta

original: viruddhaṃ katvā vadati. Lokadhammoti lujjanasabhāvadhammo. Ko pana soti āha “khandhapañcaka”nti.
analyzed: viruddham katvā vadati loka dhammo ti ko pana saḥ ti āha khandha pañcakam ti
translated: “Disputes” : he makes disputes. “Arguing” : he argues in a way that is not in accordance with the true nature of things. “Disputes in accordance with the Dhamma” : he argues in a way that is contrary to the Dhamma. “The world’s way” : the way of corruption. But what is that? He says: “the five aggregates.”

original: Tenāha “taṃ hī”tiādi. Kathaṃ karomīti kena pakārenāhaṃ bālaṃ ajānantaṃ karomi. Tenāha
analyzed: tena āha tam hi itiādi katham karomi iti kena pakārena aham bālam a jānantam karomi tena āha
translated: Therefore he says: “I have shown you” , etc. “How can I make him” : in what way can I make him a fool, an ignorant person? Therefore he says:

original: “mayhaṃ hī”tiādi. Tathā cāha “akkhāto vo mayā maggo”tiādi. “Tayo lokā kathitā”ti
analyzed: mayham hi itiādi tathā ca āha akkhātaḥ vaḥ mayā maggaḥ itiādi tayaḥ lokā kathitā ati
translated: “I have shown you” , etc. And he says: “The path has been pointed out by me” , etc. “The three worlds have been told” ,

original: vatvā taṃ vivarituṃ “nāhaṃ, bhikkhave”tiādimāha.🔽Pupphasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vatvā tam vivaritum na aham bhikkhave iti ādim āha  puppha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: having said this, in order to explain it, he says: “Monks, I do not say” , etc.🔽The commentary on the Flower Sutta is finished.

original: 3. Pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pheṇa piṇḍūpama sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Simile of the Foam Sutta

original: 95. Kenaci kāraṇena yujjhitvā gahetuṃ na sakkāti ayujjhā nāma. Nivattanaṭṭhāneti udakappavāhassa nivattitaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: kenaci kāraṇena yujjhitvā gahetum na sakkā ati ayujjhā nāma nivattana ṭhāne iti udaka ppavāhassa nivattita ṭṭhāne
translated: “Not to be taken by fighting” : not to be taken by fighting with any reason. “The place where it turns back” : the place where the water turns back.

original: Anusotāgamaneti anusotaṃ āgamanahetu, “anusotāgamanenā”ti vā pāṭho. Anupubbena pavaḍḍhitvāti
analyzed: anusota āgamana iti anusotam āgamana hetu anusota āgamanena ati vā pāṭhaḥ anupubbena pavaḍḍhitvā ati
translated: “Because of going with the stream” : because of going with the stream. “Because of going with the stream” is also a reading. “Having gradually increased” :

original: tattha tattha uṭṭhitānaṃ khuddakamahantānaṃ pheṇapiṇḍānaṃ saṃsaggena pakārato vuddhiṃ🔽patvā. Āvaheyyāti ānetvā vaheyya. Kāraṇena upaparikkheyyāti ñāṇena vīmaṃseyya. “Sāro
analyzed: tattha tattha uṭṭhitānam khuddaka mahantānam pheṇa piṇḍānam saṃsaggena pakārataḥ vuddhim  patvā āvaheyya ati ānetvā vaheyya kāraṇena upaparikkheyya ati ñāṇena vīmaṃseyya sāro
translated: having reached growth by the combination of the small and large foam-swirls that arise here and there.

original: nāma kiṃ bhaveyyā”ti vatvā sabbaso tadabhāvaṃ dassento “vilīyitvā viddhaṃseyyevā”ti🔽āha. Tena rūpampi nissāratāya bhijjatevāti dasseti. Yathā hi aniccatāya asāratāsiddhi,
analyzed: nāma kim bhaveyya ati vatvā sabbaso tad abhāvam dassentaḥ vilīyitvā viddhaṃseyya iva ati  āha tena rūpam pi nissāra tāya bhijjatā iva ati dasseti yathā hi anicca tāya
translated: “To be carried away” : to be brought and carried away. “To be examined with a reason” : to be investigated with knowledge. “What would be the essence?” : having said this, showing its complete non-existence, he said: “It would only dissolve and disappear.”🔽By this he shows that matter also breaks up because it is without essence.🔽For just as the establishment of non-essence is through impermanence,

original: evaṃ asāratāyapi aniccatāsiddhīti aniccatāya eva niccasāraṃ thirabhāvasāraṃ dhuvasāraṃ
analyzed: evam anicca tā siddhi iti anicca tāyaḥ eva nicca sāram thira bhāva sāram dhuva sāram
translated: so the establishment of impermanence is through non-essence. Therefore, by impermanence alone, he shows that it is permanent, essential, and lasting.

original: sāmīnivāsīkārakabhūtassa attano vase pavattanampettha natthīti āha “rūpampi…pe… nissāramevā”ti.
analyzed: sāmīnivāsīkāraka bhūtassa attanaḥ vase pavattanam pa ittha natthi iti āha rūpam pipe nissāram eva ati
translated: There is no keeping it under one’s control, as there is with a tamed animal, because it is not tamed by the untamedness of defilements, and so he said, “Form … down to … consciousness is not mine, I am not consciousness, consciousness is not in me” .

original: Soti pheṇapiṇḍo. Gahitopi upāyena tamatthaṃ na sādheti anarahattā. Anekasandhighaṭito
analyzed: saḥ ti pheṇa piṇḍaḥ gahitaḥ api upāyena tam attham na sādheti anarahattā aneka sandhi ghaṭitaḥ
translated: “It”: the foam-blob. Although it is seized, it does not serve its purpose because of his being an arahat.

original: tathā tathā ghaṭito hutvā.
analyzed: tathā tathā ghaṭitaḥ hutvā
translated: It is put together in this way and that way.

original: Byāmamattampi etarahi manussānaṃ vasena. Avassameva bhijjati taraṅgabbhāhataṃ hutvā.🔽Tasmiṃ tasmiṃ udakabindumhi patite. Udakatalanti udakapiṭṭhiṃ. Aññato patantaṃ udakabinduṃ.
analyzed: byāma mattam pi etarahi manussānam vasena avassam eva bhijjati taraṅga bbhā hatam hutvā  tasmin tasmin udaka bindumhi patite udaka talanti udaka piṭṭhim aññatas patantam udaka bindum
translated: “As much as a cubit” is in terms of human beings at present. It breaks up without delay, being struck by waves.🔽When each drop of water falls on it,🔽“on the water’s surface” : on the back of the water. The drop of water falling from elsewhere

original: Udakajallanti santānakaṃ hutvā ṭhitaṃ udakamalaṃ. Tañhi saṃkaḍḍhitvā tato udakaṃ
analyzed: udaka jallanti santānakam hutvā ṭhitam udaka malam tat hi saṃkaḍḍhitvā tatas udakam
