translated: ‘That is originated by temperature’ is only the temperature-originated wind that is the common support for the kamma of beings who live by means of material food.

original: Esa nayo utusamuṭṭhānasītuṇhavātesupi. Tampi hi āhārūpajīvīnaṃ sattānaṃ sādhāraṇakammūpanissayamevāti.🔽Gītanti meghagītaṃ. Saccakiriyāyāti tādisānaṃ purisavisesānaṃ saccādhiṭṭhānena. Iddhibalenāti
analyzed: esa nayaḥ utu samuṭṭhāna sītuṇha vātesu pi tam pi hi āhāra upajīvīnam sattānam sādhāraṇa kamma upanissayam eva ati  gītam ti megha gītam sacca kiriyāya ati tādisānam purisa visesānam sacca adhiṭṭhānena iddhi balena ati
translated: The same method applies to the cold and hot winds originated by temperature. For that is only the temperature-originated wind that is the common support for the kamma of beings who live by means of material food.

original: iddhimantānaṃ iddhiānubhāvena. Vināsameghenāti kappavināsakameghena. Aññenapi kaṇhapāpikasattānaṃ
analyzed: iddhimantānam iddhi ānubhāvena vināsa meghena ati kappavināsaka meghena aññena api kaṇha pāpika sattānam
translated: ‘Thunder’ is the sound of the clouds. ‘By the performance of truth’ is by the establishment of truth of such distinguished men. ‘By the power of psychic potency’ is by the psychic potency of those who possess psychic potency. ‘By the rain-cloud of dissolution’ is by the rain-cloud of the world’s end. ‘By another’ is by the rain-cloud of dissolution that arises through the bad kamma of black-natured beings.

original: pāpakammapaccayā uppannavināsameghena vuṭṭhena so so deso vinassateva.
analyzed: pāpa kamma paccayā uppanna vināsa meghena vuṭṭhena saḥ saḥ desaḥ vinassatā iva
translated: The place is destroyed by the rain-cloud of dissolution.

original: Valāhakasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: valāhakasaṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the Valāhaka Saṃyutta is ended.

original: 12. Vacchagottasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā
translated: 12. The description of the chapter on Vacchagotta

original: 607-661. Aññāṇāti aññāṇahetu, saccapaṭicchādakasammohahetūti attho. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: aññāṇā ti aññāṇa hetu sacca paṭicchādaka sammoha hetu uti atthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: “Ignorance” : the cause of ignorance, the cause of the delusion that conceals the truth. But in the Commentary

original: pana imameva atthaṃ hetuatthena karaṇavacanena dassetuṃ “aññāṇenā”ti vuttaṃ. Sabbānīti
analyzed: pana imam eva attham hetu atthena karaṇa vacanena dassetum aññāṇena ati vuttam sabbāni iti
translated: the meaning is shown by the words “through ignorance” in the sense of cause, in the instrumental case. “All” :

original: “aññāṇā adassanā anabhisamayā”tiādīni padāni ekādasasu suttesu āgatāni, pañcapaññāsa
analyzed: aññāṇā adassanā anabhisamayā ati ādīni padāni ekādasasu suttesu āgatāni pañca paññāsa
translated: the terms “ignorance, non-penetration, non-comprehension” and so on occur in eleven suttantas, and the explanations

original: veyyākaraṇāni vuttāni suttesu pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ vasena veyyākaraṇassa āgatattā.
analyzed: veyyākaraṇāni vuttāni suttesu pañcannam khandhānam vasena veyyākaraṇassa āgata ttā
translated: amount to fifty-five. They are given in the suttantas in terms of the five aggregates.

original: Vacchagottasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vacchagotta saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the chapter on Vacchagotta is ended.

original: 13. Jhānasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: jhāna saṃyuttam
translated: The chapter on jhana

original: 1. Samādhimūlakasamāpattisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samādhi mūlaka samāpatti sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the sutta on concentration and attainment

original: 662. Samādhikusaloti samādhismiṃ kusalo. Tayidaṃ samādhikosallattaṃ saha jhānaṅgayogena
analyzed: samādhi kusalaḥ iti samādhismin kusalaḥ saha jhāna aṅga yogena
translated: “Skilled in concentration” : skilled in concentration. This skill in concentration, together with the factors of jhana,

original: catubbidho jhānasamādhi, tasmā taṃ taṃ vibhāgaṃ jānantassa siddhaṃ hotīti āha – “paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: catubbidhaḥ jhāna samādhi tasmā tam tam vibhāgam jānantassa siddham hoti iti āha paṭhamam
translated: is fourfold as the jhana-concentration. Therefore it is said: “It is accomplished by one who knows the various kinds of🔽jhana.

original: jhāna”ntiādi. Tattha vitakkavicārapītisukhekaggatāvasena paṭhamaṃ pañcaṅgikaṃ, pītisukhekaggatāvasena🔽dutiyaṃ tivaṅgikaṃ, sukhekaggatāvasena tatiyaṃ duvaṅgikaṃ, upekkhekaggatāvasena catutthaṃ🔽duvaṅgikamevāti evaṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ jhāne taṃtaṃaṅgānaṃ vavatthāne kusalo. Samāpattikusaloti
analyzed: jhāna ntiādi tattha vitakka vicāra pīti sukha ikagga tā vasena paṭhamam pañcaṅgikam pīti sukha ekagga tā vasena  dutiyam tivaṅgikam sukha ikagga tā vasena tatiyam duvaṅgikam upekkhā ikagga tā vasena catuttham  duvaṅgikam eva ati evam tasmin tasmin jhāne tad tad aṅgānam vavatthāne kusalaḥ samāpatti kusalaḥ iti
translated: and jhāna. Herein, the first jhāna has five factors, namely applied thought, sustained thought, happiness, bliss, and concentration; the second has three factors, namely happiness, bliss, and concentration;

original: samāpajjane kusalo. Hāsetvāti tosetvā. Kallaṃ katvāti samādhānassa paṭipakkhadhammānaṃ
analyzed: samāpajjane kusalaḥ hāsetvā ati tosetvā kallam katvā ati samādhānassa paṭipakkha dhammānam
translated: the third has two factors, namely bliss and concentration; and the fourth has two factors, namely equanimity and concentration. So he is skilled in discerning the factors in each jhāna. Skilled in attaining: skilled in attaining them.

original: dūrīkaraṇena sahakārīkāraṇañca samādhānena samāpajjane cittaṃ samatthaṃ katvā. Sesapadānīti
analyzed: dūrīkaraṇena sahakārīkāraṇam ca samādhānena samāpajjane cittam samattham katvā sesa padāni iti
translated: Has aroused: has gladdened. Has made sufficient: has made the mind capable of attaining concentration by removing states opposing concentration and by making co-operating conditions sufficient.

original: sesā tayo koṭṭhāsā. Tatiyādīsu nayesu akusalopi jhānatthāya paṭipannattā “jhāyītevā”ti vutto.🔽Samādhimūlakasamāpattisuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2-55. Samādhimūlakaṭhitisuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: sesā tayo koṭṭhāsā tatiya ādīsu nayesu akusalaḥ api jhāna atthāya paṭipanna ttā vutto 🔽samādhi mūlaka samāpatti sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽
translated: The rest of the section: the remaining three sections. And the unprofitable person is called “a jhāna worker” too because he is devoted to jhāna in the three remaining ways.

original: 663-716. Dutiyādisuttesu ṭhitikusaloti ettha antogadhahetuattho ṭhiti-saddo, tasmiñca🔽pana kusaloti atthoti āha – “jhānaṃ ṭhapetuṃ akusalo”ti. Sattaṭṭhaaccharāmattanti
analyzed: dutiya ādi suttesu ṭhiti kusalo ti ettha antogadha hetu atthaḥ ṭhiti saddo tasmin ca  pana kusalaḥ ti attho ti āha jhānam ṭhapetum akusalaḥ ti
translated: In the second and following sutta, “skilled in steadying” : the word “steadying” has the meaning of cause included in it. And he is skilled in that,

original: sattaṭṭhaaccharāmattaṃ khaṇaṃ jhānaṃ ṭhapetuṃ na sakkoti adhiṭṭhānavasībhāvassa anipphāditattā.
analyzed: khaṇam jhānam ṭhapetum na sakkoti adhiṭṭhāna vasībhāvassa a nipphādita ttā
translated: he is skilled in steadying jhāna. He is not skilled in steadying jhāna for seven or eight watches. He is not skilled in steadying jhāna for a period of seven or eight watches because he has not reached the stage of mastery in resolution.

original: Yathāparicchedena kālena vuṭṭhātuṃ na sakkoti vuṭṭhānavasībhāvassa anipphāditattā.🔽Kallaṃ jātaṃ assāti kallitaṃ, tasmiṃ kallite kallitabhāvena kasiṇārammaṇesu “idaṃ
analyzed: yathā a paricchedena kālena vuṭṭhātum na sakkoti vuṭṭhāna vasībhāvassa a nipphādita ttā  kallam jātam assa ati kallitam tasmin kallite kallita bhāvena kasiṇa ārammaṇesu idam
translated: He is not skilled in emerging at the right time. He is not skilled in emerging from jhāna at the time he has resolved upon because he has not reached the stage of mastery in emergence.

original: nāma asukassā”ti visayavasena samāpajjituṃ asakkonto na samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo.🔽Na samādhismiṃ gocarakusaloti samādhismiṃ nipphāditabbe tassa gocare kammaṭṭhānasaññite
analyzed: nāma asukassa ati visaya vasena samāpajjitum a sakkontaḥ na samādhismim ārammaṇa kusalaḥ  na samādhismim gocara kusalaḥ ti samādhismim nipphāditabbe tassa gocare kammaṭṭhāna saññite
translated: What is called “defiled” is “defilement” . He is not skilled in the object in jhāna in the sense of the object’s particularity in this defilement. He is not skilled in the object in jhāna in the sense of the object’s particularity in the defilement. He is not able to enter upon jhāna in the kasiṇa as object by defining its particularity thus, “This is blue, this is yellow,” etc.🔽He is not skilled in the resort in jhāna. He is not skilled in the resort in jhāna because he lacks mindfulness and full awareness in the resort in jhāna, that is, in the meditation subject consisting in the resort, and in the resort in the sense of the place for wandering, that is, in the place for wandering consisting in the resort.

original: pavattiṭṭhāne bhikkhācāragocare ca satisampajaññavirahito akusalo. Keci pana “kammaṭṭhānagocaro
analyzed: pavatti ṭṭhāne bhikkhā ācāra gocare ca sati sampajañña virahitaḥ akusalo keci pana kammaṭṭhāna gocaro
translated: Some, however, have taken the words “skilled in the resort in jhāna” to mean skilled in the meditation subject as the resort for jhāna.

original: paṭhamajjhānādikaṃ, ‘evaṃ samāpajjitabbaṃ, evaṃ bahulīkātabba’nti ajānanto tattha
analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna ādikam evam samāpajjitabbam evam bahulīkātabbam ti a jānantaḥ tattha
translated: He is unskilled in the attainment of the first jhāna, etc., in the way beginning ‘He should attain it thus, he should develop it thus.’

original: akusalo nāmā”ti vadanti. Kammaṭṭhānaṃ abhinīharitunti kammaṭṭhānaṃ visesabhāgiyatāya🔽abhinīharituṃ akusalo. Sakkaccakārīti cittīkārī. Sātaccakārīti niyatakārī. Samādhissa
analyzed: akusalaḥ nāma ati vadanti kammaṭṭhānam abhinīharitun ti kammaṭṭhānam visesa bhāgiya tāya  abhinīharitum akusalaḥ sakkacca kārī iti cittīkārī sātacca kārī iti niyata kārī samādhissa
translated: He is unskilled in the way beginning ‘He should attain it thus, he should develop it thus’ in the first jhāna, etc., because of the need for the special qualities of the jhāna to be mentioned in the next chapter .🔽He is unskilled in bringing the meditation subject to the fore, in making it plain, in making it evident.🔽He is unskilled in bringing the meditation subject to the fore, in making it plain, in making it evident, because of the need for the special qualities of the jhāna to be mentioned in the next chapter .🔽He is a doer of what is proper: he is a doer of what is fitting.🔽He is a doer of what is persistent: he is a regular doer.

original: upakārakadhammāti appanākosallā. Samāpattiādīhīti ādi-saddena sakkaccakāripadādīnaṃyeva
analyzed: upakāraka dhammā ti appanā ākosallā samāpatti ādīhi iti ādi saddena sakkacca kāri pada ādīnam yeva
translated: Factors that help concentration: skill in attaining absorption.🔽In the attainment, etc.: the word “etc.” should be understood to include the doer of what is proper, etc., since four tetrads are mentioned.

original: saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo catukkānaṃ vuttattā. Tenāha “yojetvā catukkā vuttā”ti. Lokiyajjhānavaseneva
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ catukkānam vutta ttā tena āha yojetvā catukkā vuttā iti lokiya jhāna vasena iva
translated: That is why it is said, “The four tetrads are mentioned by combining them” .

original: kathitaṃ “samādhikusalo”tiādinā nayena desanāya pavattattā. Na hi lokuttaradhammesu
analyzed: kathitam samādhi kusala uti ādinā nayena desanāya pavatta ttā na hi lokuttara dhammesu
translated: It is said only in terms of mundane jhāna because the teaching proceeds in this way in the way beginning, “Skilled in concentration” .🔽For there is no such thing as unskillfulness in supramundane states.

original: akosallaṃ nāma labbhati. Yadi akosallaṃ, na kusalasaddena visesitabbatā siyāti.🔽Samādhimūlakaṭhitisuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: akosallam nāma labbhati yadi akosallam na kusala saddena visesitabba tā siyāti
translated: If there were, it would not be specified by the word “skill” .🔽The commentary on the Sutta on the Standing Up with Concentration as a Basis, etc., is ended.

original: Jhānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jhāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the Jhānavagga is ended.

original: Niṭṭhitā ca sāratthappakāsiniyā
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca sārattha ppakāsiniyā
translated: And the commentary on the Khandhavagga in the Saṃyutta-nikāya,

original: Saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya khandhavaggavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya khandha vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: which explains the meaning of the text, is finished.
